We globally make gate-.*-pypy non-voting, thus remove the non-voting
jobs from the gate queue.

commit_message:
Fix the two centos70 nodeset to install correct puppet

The two centos nodeset has an el6 puppet version configured.
Consequently all beaker specs with this nodesets fail during the
puppet installation step.

Change-Id: I511bea7320cd58d8e138cd403861475ce2f8e9e5

commit_message:
Remove username from logs

Username is logged while establishing vCenter session. This patch
removes username in the log as per OpenStack security guidelines.

See https://goo.gl/aSJids

commit_message:
Remove tight loop from notifications process

Block on join()ing threads instead of a tight no op loop.
This should reduce CPU usage of an otherwise idle RUG.

Change-Id: Ife8a5e1092bf13f431ddbfa6fd6751551df82ff4
Closes-bug: #1475781

commit_message:
Add config option to override url for versions

The versions url returns the wrong data when cinder api is behind
a proxy. This adds a new config option so it can be set properly.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I46a90120b21e43bf8dca9e5f0efdf339f0d3e8e6
Closes-Bug: #1384379
Closes-Bug: #1464160
(cherry picked from commit 2eb25ab8803214cb3beb5d8fe3efbf70a462c414)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-24 06:54:31.000000000', 'files': ['devops/models/node.py', 'devops/models/environment.py'], 'message': 'Change nodes so that they end in admin mac suffix instead of number

Previously the nodes would end in a number iterator to ensure they were
unique, however this makes working with the nodes generated this way
difficult as they are referred to by their admin interface mac.

This changes it so the slave nodes will receive the suffix of the admin
mac.

Closes-bug: #1424276

'}]
commit_message:
Change nodes so that they end in admin mac suffix instead of number

Previously the nodes would end in a number iterator to ensure they were
unique, however this makes working with the nodes generated this way
difficult as they are referred to by their admin interface mac.

This changes it so the slave nodes will receive the suffix of the admin
mac.

Closes-bug: #1424276
Change-Id: Iab5b5caa1b10c89d32eb60a1f5b4cbfbb4e58d56

subject: Configure dogtag installation's domain name
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6783, 'name': 'Nathan Reller', 'email': 'nathan.s.reller@gmail.com', 'username': 'rellerreller'}, {'_account_id': 7136, 'name': 'Chad Lung', 'email': 'chad.lung@gmail.com', 'username': 'chadlung'}, {'_account_id': 7262, 'name': 'John Vrbanac', 'email': 'john.vrbanac@linux.com', 'username': 'john.vrbanac'}, {'_account_id': 7789, 'name': 'John Wood', 'email': 'john.wood@rackspace.com', 'username': 'woodster'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendizábal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 8004, 'name': 'Paul Kehrer', 'email': 'paul.l.kehrer@gmail.com', 'username': 'reaperhulk'}, {'_account_id': 8623, 'name': 'Kaitlin Farr', 'email': 'kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'kaitlin.farr'}, {'_account_id': 9234, 'name': 'Steve Heyman', 'email': 'steve@heyman.com', 'username': 'hockeynut'}, {'_account_id': 9914, 'name': 'Ade Lee', 'email': 'alee@redhat.com', 'username': 'alee'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}, {'_account_id': 11970, 'name': 'Chelsea Winfree', 'email': 'chelsea.winfree@gmail.com', 'username': 'chellygel'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-07-22 13:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/barbican'], 'message': "Configure dogtag installation's domain name

It seems that previously we were overriding the /etc/hosts in an
incorrect way. The gate had already several aliases for localhost which
we were completely discarding, and this might cause some issues with
some assumptions that were being taken in the gate.

On the other hand, a newer version of dogtag that is now being used in
the gate requires there to be a proper DNS domain name configured, and
this was causing the installation to fail in the gate.

So as a solution, we now force the fqdn to be localhost.localdomain. And
on the other hand, we explicitly configure dogtag to use localhost as a
hostname, since it was actually getting an alias from the hostname
command, which was not being found with the domain it was fetching from
the dnsdomainname command.

Closes-Bug: #1477118
Change-Id: I7ea518ddc35ac96fb8594d57a1a46a32f30bf3c0
"}]
commit_message:
Configure dogtag installation's domain name

It seems that previously we were overriding the /etc/hosts in an
incorrect way. The gate had already several aliases for localhost which
we were completely discarding, and this might cause some issues with
some assumptions that were being taken in the gate.

On the other hand, a newer version of dogtag that is now being used in
the gate requires there to be a proper DNS domain name configured, and
this was causing the installation to fail in the gate.

So as a solution, we now force the fqdn to be localhost.localdomain. And
on the other hand, we explicitly configure dogtag to use localhost as a
hostname, since it was actually getting an alias from the hostname
command, which was not being found with the domain it was fetching from
the dnsdomainname command.

Closes-Bug: #1477118
Change-Id: I7ea518ddc35ac96fb8594d57a1a46a32f30bf3c0

commit_message:
delete python bytecode before every test run

Stale .pyc's can make tests fail so make sure they are automatically
deleted before each tox run.

Closes-Bug: #1471895

Change-Id: Idf3a46d8c95806f2d2ce28ce84ced12b625e53df

commit_message:
Allow configuration of all default quota options

Add all remaining configurable default quota options for nova, neutron,
and cinder.

Based on commit 8f593e92a65aabb713be805fef80bf36df3e50f3, with changes
for directory structure and slight option differences specific to Juno.

Removed nova_quota_networks

Added neutron_quota_firewall, neutron_quota_firewall_policy, and
neutron_quota_firewall_rule

Change-Id: I3bbbba2f2ca9495c7060ffa5ac5d70e865758518
Closes-Bug: #1446431

commit_message:
Add new role - compute-vmware

WORK IN PROGRESS: DO NOT MERGE!

New role will allow deploy nova-compute service with VCDriver configured
on a standalone host.

The role can not be combined with any other existing roles.

While here correct "VSphere" writing to "vSphere".

Implements: bluprint compute-vmware-role
DocImpact: User guide must describe new roles
DocImpact: Screenshots need update
Change-Id: Id7d21471c311bc02612896e023d8d19ae0178565

commit_message:
Adapt management HAproxy/VIP/VR to advanced networking

Use network role *mgmt/vip* to configure HAproxy, virtual IP and virtual router.
As HAproxy and virtual IPs are connected, changes to VIPs influences HAproxy.
Some cleanups as well.

blueprint: templates-for-networking
Change-Id: I9e6ceab1c1709ff638856f1a3f777f735dd6c639

commit_message:
Added test for checking logrotate

The test generates one big log file then run the logrotate
with command fetched from 'crontab -l' output.
This allow to save time because test shouldn't wait for cron trigger

Closes-bug: #1447488

Change-Id: I56e5045cb970d5ce0bc0ff06589f2a6a7a5ccc1e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-17 17:22:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/models/head.py'], 'message': 'Add address_scope_db to neutron/models/head.py

The head.py file ensures that all relevant models are
imported when ModelsMigrationSync tests are run in
neutron/tests/functional/db/test_migrations.   This is
one of the models that needs to be present else the
"address_scopes" table comes out as missing.   The
error is usually concealed by the fact that the module
was imported as a side effect of other tests but
is revealed if one runs test_migrations.py alone.

Change-Id: I954d8385c479de663ef1a5ef439866d2d927bcf3
'}]
commit_message:
Add address_scope_db to neutron/models/head.py

The head.py file ensures that all relevant models are
imported when ModelsMigrationSync tests are run in
neutron/tests/functional/db/test_migrations.   This is
one of the models that needs to be present else the
"address_scopes" table comes out as missing.   The
error is usually concealed by the fact that the module
was imported as a side effect of other tests but
is revealed if one runs test_migrations.py alone.

Change-Id: I954d8385c479de663ef1a5ef439866d2d927bcf3

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 425, 'name': 'Darren Birkett', 'email': 'darren.birkett@gmail.com', 'username': 'darren-birkett'}, {'_account_id': 2556, 'name': 'Evan Callicoat', 'email': 'apsu@propter.net', 'username': 'diopter'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7219, 'name': 'git-harry', 'email': 'git-harry@live.co.uk', 'username': 'git-harry'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 14578, 'name': 'Tom Cameron', 'email': 'tom.cameron@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tom.cameron'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-21 23:32:59.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/files/policy-rc.d', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_started.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_stopped.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_cluster.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_upgrade_prep.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_restart.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_set_cookie.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_upgrade_check.yml', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_pre_install.yml'], 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq playbook to allow upgrades

The rabbitmq playbook is designed to run in parallel across the cluster.
This causes an issue when upgrading rabbitmq to a new major or minor
version because RabbitMQ does not support doing an online migration of
datasets between major versions. while a minor release can be upgrade
while online it is recommended to bring down the cluster to do any
upgrade actions. The current configuration takes no account of this.

Reference:
https://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading for further details.

* A new variable has been added called `rabbitmq_upgrade`. This is set to
  false by default to prevent a new version being installed unintentionally.
  To run the upgrade, which will shutdown the cluster, the variable can be
  set to true on the commandline:

  Example:
    openstack-ansible -e rabbitmq_upgrade=true \
    rabbitmq-install.yml

* A new variable has been added called `rabbitmq_ignore_version_state`
  which can be set "true" to ignore the package and version state tasks.
  This has been provided to allow a deployer to rerun the plays in an
  environment where the playbooks have been upgraded and the default
  version of rabbitmq has changed within the role and the deployer has
  elected to upgraded the installation at that time. This will ensure a
  deployer is able to recluster an environment as needed without
  effecting the package state.

  Example:
    openstack-ansible -e rabbitmq_ignore_version_state=true \
    rabbitmq-install.yml

* A new variable has been added `rabbitmq_primary_cluster_node` which
  allows a deployer to elect / set the primary cluster node in an
  environment. This variable is used to determine the restart order
  of RabbitMQ nodes. IE this will be the last node down and first one
  up in an environment. By default this variable is set to:
  rabbitmq_primary_cluster_node: "{{ groups['rabbitmq_all'][0] }}"

scripts/run-upgrade.sh has been modified to pass 'rabbitmq_upgrade=true'
on the command line so that RabbitMQ can be upgraded as part of the
upgrade between OpenStack versions.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I17d4429b9b94d47c1578dd58a2fb20698d1fe02e
Closes-bug: #1474992
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq playbook to allow upgrades

The rabbitmq playbook is designed to run in parallel across the cluster.
This causes an issue when upgrading rabbitmq to a new major or minor
version because RabbitMQ does not support doing an online migration of
datasets between major versions. while a minor release can be upgrade
while online it is recommended to bring down the cluster to do any
upgrade actions. The current configuration takes no account of this.

Reference:
https://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading for further details.

* A new variable has been added called `rabbitmq_upgrade`. This is set to
  false by default to prevent a new version being installed unintentionally.
  To run the upgrade, which will shutdown the cluster, the variable can be
  set to true on the commandline:

  Example:
    openstack-ansible -e rabbitmq_upgrade=true \
    rabbitmq-install.yml

* A new variable has been added called `rabbitmq_ignore_version_state`
  which can be set "true" to ignore the package and version state tasks.
  This has been provided to allow a deployer to rerun the plays in an
  environment where the playbooks have been upgraded and the default
  version of rabbitmq has changed within the role and the deployer has
  elected to upgraded the installation at that time. This will ensure a
  deployer is able to recluster an environment as needed without
  effecting the package state.

  Example:
    openstack-ansible -e rabbitmq_ignore_version_state=true \
    rabbitmq-install.yml

* A new variable has been added `rabbitmq_primary_cluster_node` which
  allows a deployer to elect / set the primary cluster node in an
  environment. This variable is used to determine the restart order
  of RabbitMQ nodes. IE this will be the last node down and first one
  up in an environment. By default this variable is set to:
  rabbitmq_primary_cluster_node: "{{ groups['rabbitmq_all'][0] }}"

scripts/run-upgrade.sh has been modified to pass 'rabbitmq_upgrade=true'
on the command line so that RabbitMQ can be upgraded as part of the
upgrade between OpenStack versions.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I17d4429b9b94d47c1578dd58a2fb20698d1fe02e
Closes-bug: #1474992

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-21 16:21:10.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "fix 'udevd: can not read' warnings

Those warnings appear when fuel-agent performs udev rules

commit_message:
fix 'udevd: can not read' warnings

Those warnings appear when fuel-agent performs udev rules
blacklisting.

Adding a syncing with udev via 'udevadm settle' to the lines which
actually manipulate with these rules, totally eliminates those scary
warnings.

Change-Id: I9e528f948f83d97e9cf084e3b2c3250eef518c5e
Closes-Bug: #1422717

commit_message:
Support Neutron DVR mode

DVR requires Public network access from compute nodes but
doesn't require IP address assigned to external bridge.
This patch is to save extra ip addresses from Public network
in DVR mode

Implements: blueprint neutron-dvr-deployment
Change-Id: I2f59a806e77e1dfcee29437d0b664ad7285a030b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-21 13:38:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/utils.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/none_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_none_resource.py'], 'message': 'Add OS::Heat::None resource

Adds a new resource, designed to enable easy "stubbing out"
of resources via the environment resource_registry.

It takes any properties, and returns any attribute (as None),
meaning it can be uses in place of "noop" nested stacks which
dummy an existing resources by matching parameters/outputs to
properties/attributes.

Implements: blueprint noop-resource
Change-Id: Idc485a9fcf7287030dda22f893486279be9e1a68
'}]
commit_message:
Add OS::Heat::None resource

Adds a new resource, designed to enable easy "stubbing out"
of resources via the environment resource_registry.

It takes any properties, and returns any attribute (as None),
meaning it can be uses in place of "noop" nested stacks which
dummy an existing resources by matching parameters/outputs to
properties/attributes.

Implements: blueprint noop-resource
Change-Id: Idc485a9fcf7287030dda22f893486279be9e1a68

commit_message:
Convergence: Fix resource loading on cleanup

The old template object is assigned to the stack object
when resources are loaded to preserve the old environment
on cleanup operations.

subject: The vnf-create and vnfd-create output is hard to read
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 13380, 'name': 'Sridhar Ramaswamy', 'email': 'srics.r@gmail.com', 'username': 'srics-r'}, {'_account_id': 13485, 'name': 'Sripriya Seetharam', 'email': 'sseetha@brocade.com', 'username': 'Sripriya'}, {'_account_id': 16511, 'name': 'Bob Haddleton', 'email': 'bob.haddleton@nokia.com', 'username': 'bobh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-18 21:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['tackerclient/tacker/v1_0/__init__.py', 'tackerclient/tacker/v1_0/vm/vnf.py', 'tackerclient/tacker/v1_0/vm/vnfd.py'], 'message': 'The vnf-create and vnfd-create output is hard to read

  * The vnf and vnfd create output text contains the "attributes"
    field which is so large that it makes it impossible to format
    the output text so it is readable.

  * Modified the CreateCommand class to provide the ability to
    remove specified fields from the output of the create command

  * Modified the CreateVNF and CreateVNFD classes to specify that
    the "attributes" field should be removed from the output of
    the create command.

Change-Id: I7563175a2cec3e3e9528b66153354aec982a14b4
Closes-Bug: 1474975
'}]
commit_message:
The vnf-create and vnfd-create output is hard to read

  * The vnf and vnfd create output text contains the "attributes"
    field which is so large that it makes it impossible to format
    the output text so it is readable.

  * Modified the CreateCommand class to provide the ability to
    remove specified fields from the output of the create command

  * Modified the CreateVNF and CreateVNFD classes to specify that
    the "attributes" field should be removed from the output of
    the create command.

Change-Id: I7563175a2cec3e3e9528b66153354aec982a14b4
Closes-Bug: 1474975

commit_message:
Ensure validations account for trailing newlines

The regex's used for validation allowed "\n" terminated strings
to pass, allowing invalid data through.

Change-Id: Iae4c40ffab9951280bb6d67c2a7cb779dc7ddf0f
Closes-Bug: 1471158

commit_message:
Add haproxy keys saving for internal and management endpoints

Add SSL keys saving for different endpoints. Supported endpoints:
* public (was in previous commits, rewritten for consistency)
* internal

Add haproxy SSL part for internal network (mgmt VIP). Be aware -
we deliver many services (excepts: Keystone) via mgmt VIP both
for internal and admin OpenStack endpoints - so with this we
actually will have internal part over SSL and internal endoints
over SSL but admin endpoints over HTTP and it will point to SSL-
aware port on HAProxy. It is a bug, but we need to deliver this
ASAP and we will split this part later or will implement both
internal and admin UI part with one certificate.

List of services:
* keystone
* glance
* cinder
* nova (be aware - there is a bug in nova image-list)
* neutron
* swift
* heat
* murano
* sahara
* ceph

Add keystone internal endpoints via SSL for next services:
* keystone
* glance-api
* cinder v1
* cinder v2
* nova (be aware - there is a bug in nova image-list)
* neutron
* swift
* heat
* murano
* sahara
* ceph

WORK IN PROGRESS
TBD:
* ceilometer
* test all of this

Depends-On: Ib04fa5df146b440b8d8b3187888d860e6745fc8c
Change-Id: I7c5dbb81068f42158800a0b6e655efb151dc82b5

commit_message:
Decouple instance object tests from the api fakes module

The instance tests were written back when the only non-db model of an instance
we had was in the api fakes module. That module is problematic in several ways,
but also needs to change to be non-db-focused soon. This patch converts
the instance object tests to use fake_db_instance to break it away from the api
fakes module.

Related to bp/drop-flavor-compat

Change-Id: Ib790dce76394ce64e9a0faed0f51cce08d256cd5

commit_message:
MongoDB cluster taskmanager's add_shard not called

Change the cast method to the correct string. The current string is bad, so
the task of configuring the replica set and adding the shard to the
cluster is not completed.

Change-Id: Ide4ba186ea57ab9a2c088eef1588c32d51f43f8c
Closes-Bug: 1470850

New PIP v7.x has incompatible change for requirements markers,
so we have SyntaxError while running tox, since pip can not
parse python_version

See notes for version 7.0.0 (2015-05-21):
https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/news.html#release-notes

Closes-Bug: 1477135
'}]
commit_message:
[Fix] Update test-requirements.txt for new PIP 7.x parser

New PIP v7.x has incompatible change for requirements markers,
so we have SyntaxError while running tox, since pip can not
parse python_version

See notes for version 7.0.0 (2015-05-21):
https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/news.html#release-notes

Change-Id: Id5824b01ed9002a8722f527c5ea72e1b1c5ac19d
Closes-Bug: 1477135

In the interest of smaller CRs, this CR partially implements the
quota support blueprint.  It includes code for configuration,
controller, and validator.  Also, the framework for unit and functional
tests.

The controllers process the URL rsources /qoutas and /project-quotas.
The configuration code reads the quota default values from the [quotas]
section of barbican.conf.  The validator code checks the validity of
the JSON sent with a POST /project-quotas/ API command.

Implements: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources
Change-Id: Iad09b19cf6b9a6fa6b29d8b99e3f72172f801070
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Configuration, Controllers, and Validators for Resource Quotas

In the interest of smaller CRs, this CR partially implements the
quota support blueprint.  It includes code for configuration,
controller, and validator.  Also, the framework for unit and functional
tests.

The controllers process the URL rsources /qoutas and /project-quotas.
The configuration code reads the quota default values from the [quotas]
section of barbican.conf.  The validator code checks the validity of
the JSON sent with a POST /project-quotas/ API command.

Implements: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources
Change-Id: Iad09b19cf6b9a6fa6b29d8b99e3f72172f801070

commit_message:
Add serializer for network role template

Serializer switching between general and template is added also.
When template is loaded, template serializer is being used.
General serializer is in use otherwise.

Change-Id: I1820d3cd80a33b292f9e2b75d8f0dea3bad7c8ac
Implements: blueprint templates-for-networking

commit_message:
Add ability to set reserved_host_memory

This change adds new parameter reserved_host_memory for openstack::compute.

Common use case for this parameter is to allow set non-default value for
nova-compute with ironic compute_driver.

Implemets: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)

Change-Id: I4615c229d2e917fa0b02e4c5f4f06b822de0cf21

commit_message:
Ubuntu based bootstrap

The bootstrap image is generated during the master node deployment.
It does not use the hard-coded ssh keypair any more.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Depends-On: I68f906290d28166e57c55fb5a16fb0485769dc69
Depends-On: I8916208ec5a7e54b4c784861fe20a94737267f76

Change-Id: Ibb6ac65fdbf492f0616776a2c05745f46095ed6f

Update the first block storage example to the spec (1)

Sync up the first block storage example with the latest spec
except for the scalar-unit input type. Also, add a unit test
for it and remove redundant block storage unit tests.

commit_message:
Allow ability to override mongo role name

Adds the possibility to install mongo without connection
to ceilometer with a custom role.

Partial blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers

Change-Id: Idcb064b6193c03776594efd5edf913169940ea1b
Co-Auhtored-By: Andrey Kirilochkin <akirilochkin@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add patches for Heat module to reach 6.0.0 (stable/kilo) version

  Head is 6.0.0 tag (stable/kilo) now:
  commit I313824fa2ac64c0ce0240921695fab276556d7e5

  Update patch "Add retries for heat domain commands"
  to pass internal module tests:
  commit If89a595c909f277febaa1e33acc409567d281647

  Partially implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: I0b3d7f44dded333a536b8ac49a2d3649dbf04e7f

commit_message:
Add warning to fuelmenu about default password

* "Fuel User" is now the first position on the left menu,
  (was Network Setup) so it's also first screen that
  user is going to see.
* Added warning about default password change which appears
  on fuelmenu startup.
* Added "secure" password recommendations.

Change-Id: I782112c60743d65ce2fdffafb7f039fe36225e59
Implements: blueprint default-fuel-master-password

Remove PIP cache for Magnum

We only install these pip files once so there is no need for
a 50MB PIP cache stored in the image permanently.

Change-Id: I75c8154c764db85b3115b4d28fc136855523df05

commit_message:
Remove PIP cache for Heat

We only install packages one time so there is no benefit to
storing 50MB of PIP cache data.

commit_message:
Cap mock<1.1.0 for stable/kilo

Release 1.1.0 of mock exposed some problems in our test suite.
Capping the release used in kilo will keep the stable branch working
until we figure out how to fix those issues and decide whether to
backport the fixes.

Change-Id: I2482c6ff57ddadf471a479274cfc6d41a375d29e

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-05-01 15:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/docker-hypervisor-plugin.rst'], 'message': 'Add the docker hypervisor plugin to Nova

By adding this plugin back to the Nova source tree, we will enable
operators to use docker containers in OpenStack with full scheduling.

As of the Icehouse release, the nova-docker hypervisor plugin was
removed as many of the Tempest tests were failing. Many of the tests
were failing due to missing APIs in docker and subsequently missing
functionality in the plugin.  There has been significant progress
implementing those missing features and fixing various bugs associated
with the already existing features. As a result we now have extensive
Tempest test coverage.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I420bfa6740a2fb1e2b7bfb976975387e3ea57992
'}]
commit_message:
Add the docker hypervisor plugin to Nova

By adding this plugin back to the Nova source tree, we will enable
operators to use docker containers in OpenStack with full scheduling.

As of the Icehouse release, the nova-docker hypervisor plugin was
removed as many of the Tempest tests were failing. Many of the tests
were failing due to missing APIs in docker and subsequently missing
functionality in the plugin.  There has been significant progress
implementing those missing features and fixing various bugs associated
with the already existing features. As a result we now have extensive
Tempest test coverage.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I420bfa6740a2fb1e2b7bfb976975387e3ea57992

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary 'index' in url of catalog panel

Previously, the url of catalog panel is murano/catalog/index. The ‘index’ is
unnecessary, and is not the same as the url style of other panels in murano. So
remove it.

Change-Id: Ifb93750db9e2385699aa0c1fe6614983a433eb08
Closes-Bug: #1476686

commit_message:
Revert: requirement files in alphabetical order

This manually reverts commit 07827ed717f94ed05027787cc0c875e0a2e18844
which sorted the requirement files in alphabetical order and added a
test to ensure that they were sorted.

The requirement files should not be sorted:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/044736.html

Change-Id: I8917b85ad1d8571dc36ecda7570ee53c4e5da72d

commit_message:
Rearrange the tempest jobs under right section

This patch re-arranges the tempest jobs under
right section headers.
There was new section added to the tempest jobs
called "Jobs for other configs". This patch
will move the non-kilo and non-juno specific
jobs to this general section.

Change-Id: Ifb1e342845ccc4ff0f82f6ce55d9e1dbb55a1cec

commit_message:
Fix the wrong platform usage

As 'vm' is not proper for platform, we now used server_type
to replace platfrom. As server_type can be vm or baremetal(bm) etc.

Closes-Bug: #1473257
Change-Id: I9e769e73ba3ea48069f0e69c4a93240bb1fe6c63

commit_message:
Cinder multiple backend feature

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cinder-multi-backend

Parameters for cinder multiple backends have to be be described in YAML file
Example:

cinder_backends:
  rbd:
    rbd0:
      rbd_pool: pool
      rbd_user: user
  netapp:
    netapp0:
      netapp_server_hostname: 10.10.0.18,
      netapp_volume_list: volume_list
      netapp_login: netapp_login
      netapp_password: netapp_password
    netapp1:
      netapp_server_hostname: 10.10.0.90,
      netapp_volume_list: volume_list
      netapp_login: netapp_login
      netapp_password: netapp_password
  iscsi:
    iscsi0:
      iscsi_ip_address: 192.168.1.2
      volume_group: cinder

Change-Id: If9fe125743a41b5d2df292ba3a6f553bd731c7da

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-14 16:41:26.000000000', 'files': ['ApacheHTTPServer/package/UI/ui.yaml'], 'message': 'Utilize Custom Network selector in Apache App

A new control allowing to select existing networks for the instance to
join has been implemented in Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af

This patch modifies Apache HTTP Server application to utilize this
control. It adds it to the "configure instance" dialog step of the
wizard and passes the values returned from the control to the 'networks'
section of instance object in the generated Object Model.

Note, that this also bumps the "Version" of the used UI definition
notaion to 2.1, so this app becomes incompatible with pre-Liberty Murano
releases and with the Murano built from Liberty master prior the landing
of Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af.

Depends-On: Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af

Change-Id: I98ec3ce1992cc6ddbabd3f9ea79891dc952c51a6
'}]
commit_message:
Utilize Custom Network selector in Apache App

A new control allowing to select existing networks for the instance to
join has been implemented in Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af

This patch modifies Apache HTTP Server application to utilize this
control. It adds it to the "configure instance" dialog step of the
wizard and passes the values returned from the control to the 'networks'
section of instance object in the generated Object Model.

Note, that this also bumps the "Version" of the used UI definition
notaion to 2.1, so this app becomes incompatible with pre-Liberty Murano
releases and with the Murano built from Liberty master prior the landing
of Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af.

Depends-On: Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af

Change-Id: I98ec3ce1992cc6ddbabd3f9ea79891dc952c51a6

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-01-26 14:42:49.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/simple/api.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/db/__init__.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'glance/domain/proxy.py', 'glance/domain/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_domain.py', 'glance/db/registry/api.py'], 'message': 'v2 update image persists only modified attributes

v2 implementation of image update fetches the image object from DB
repository, forms a domain object, modifies its attributes and
properties, passes the object through all the layers of domain model
and then saves the object into DB repository.

The current implementation of this update forms the UPDATE query out
of all the properties of the domain object, be they updated or not.
This leads to updating all the values in database row, instead of
updates in needed columns only.
This increases the risk of race conditions (when two concurrent
operations modify different sets of fields and interfere), introduces
extra load on database etc.

This change introduces the StateTrackingObject class which may be used
as a superclass for all the domain objects. This class tracks the
modifications of all the attributes in the domain objects and thus is
able to filter-out the unaffected ones. This is used to update only the
modified fields of the images.
Similar logic is used for extra properties: instead of iterating
through all the extra properties of the image and dropping the ones
which are not found, the ExtraProperties collection now tracks its own
modifications, so the DB repository is aware about the deleted and
updated extra properties, and may process them efficiently.

Change-Id: Ib0a63a90bc9dcbc38e87e4d3871a02590187c7b5
Related-Bug: #1371728
'}]
commit_message:
v2 update image persists only modified attributes

v2 implementation of image update fetches the image object from DB
repository, forms a domain object, modifies its attributes and
properties, passes the object through all the layers of domain model
and then saves the object into DB repository.

The current implementation of this update forms the UPDATE query out
of all the properties of the domain object, be they updated or not.
This leads to updating all the values in database row, instead of
updates in needed columns only.
This increases the risk of race conditions (when two concurrent
operations modify different sets of fields and interfere), introduces
extra load on database etc.

This change introduces the StateTrackingObject class which may be used
as a superclass for all the domain objects. This class tracks the
modifications of all the attributes in the domain objects and thus is
able to filter-out the unaffected ones. This is used to update only the
modified fields of the images.
Similar logic is used for extra properties: instead of iterating
through all the extra properties of the image and dropping the ones
which are not found, the ExtraProperties collection now tracks its own
modifications, so the DB repository is aware about the deleted and
updated extra properties, and may process them efficiently.

Change-Id: Ib0a63a90bc9dcbc38e87e4d3871a02590187c7b5
Related-Bug: #1371728

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 7195, 'name': 'Matthew Mosesohn', 'email': 'raytrac3r@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmosesohn'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-10 15:36:52.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_tasks_templates.py', 'fuel_agent/requirements.txt', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/tasks_templates.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/config.py'], 'message': 'fuel_agent: build IBP images in a proper directory

Use /var/lib/fuel/ibp as a default image build directory. This
directory will be backed by a volume in the mcollective container
which reduces IO overhead and makes image build time reasonable.

fuel_agent (which builds Ubuntu images) runs in the mcollective
container. A container filesystem is backed by dm-snapshot which
is known to have a poor write performance, especially for large
files (like OS images). By default docker storage is a loopback file
residing in /var/lib/docker. Thus the data written to the OS image
being built goes through a number of layers:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> hard drive

If the master node runs on a VM rather than a physcial hardware
the above chain gets even more complicated:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> virtual hard drive (qemu) -> qcow2 -> ext4 (host)

Using the volume makes it possible to eliminate the extra layers,
so the written data goes through

ext4 -> loop -> ext4 -> dm-linear (os-var) -> hard drive

Related-Bug: #1457643
Change-Id: Ic4d258523aa13b3879a730edb2d910522ec24c93
'}]
commit_message:
fuel_agent: build IBP images in a proper directory

Use /var/lib/fuel/ibp as a default image build directory. This
directory will be backed by a volume in the mcollective container
which reduces IO overhead and makes image build time reasonable.

fuel_agent (which builds Ubuntu images) runs in the mcollective
container. A container filesystem is backed by dm-snapshot which
is known to have a poor write performance, especially for large
files (like OS images). By default docker storage is a loopback file
residing in /var/lib/docker. Thus the data written to the OS image
being built goes through a number of layers:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> hard drive

If the master node runs on a VM rather than a physcial hardware
the above chain gets even more complicated:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> virtual hard drive (qemu) -> qcow2 -> ext4 (host)

Using the volume makes it possible to eliminate the extra layers,
so the written data goes through

ext4 -> loop -> ext4 -> dm-linear (os-var) -> hard drive

Related-Bug: #1457643
Change-Id: Ic4d258523aa13b3879a730edb2d910522ec24c93

commit_message:
docker: create a mount point for IBP image build directory

Makes IBP images build time reasonable, especially if the master
node runs in a VM.

fuel_agent (which builds Ubuntu images) runs in the mcollective
container. In general OS setup generates quite a lot of IO.
fuel_agent builds the OS image in a loopback filesystem, which
results in an extra overhead. A container filesystem is backed
by dm-snapshot which is known to have a poor write performance,
especially for large files (like OS images). By default docker
storage is a loopback file residing in /var/lib/docker. Thus
the data written to the OS image being built goes through a number
of layers:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> hard drive

If the master node runs on a VM rather than a physcial hardware
the above chain gets even more complicated:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> virtual hard drive (qemu) -> qcow2 -> ext4 (host)

The write performance of such a setup is awful, as a result making
the basic Ubuntu installation takes more than 15 minutes.

Using the volume makes it possible to eliminate the extra layers,
so the written data goes through

ext4 -> loop -> ext4 -> dm-linear (os-var) -> hard drive

Related-Bug: #1457643
Change-Id: Ie47be6227e48049bc1dd3bb46fb1e58fd06d194f

commit_message:
docker: create a host volume for building IBP images

Makes IBP images build time reasonable, especially if the master
node runs in a VM.

fuel_agent (which builds Ubuntu images) runs in the mcollective
container. In general OS setup generates quite a lot of IO.
fuel_agent builds the OS image in a loopback filesystem, which
results in an extra overhead. A container filesystem is backed
by dm-snapshot which is known to have a poor write performance,
especially for large files (like OS images). By default docker
storage is a loopback file residing in /var/lib/docker. Thus
the data written to the OS image being built goes through a number
of layers:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> hard drive

If the master node runs on a VM rather than a physcial hardware
the above chain gets even more complicated:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> virtual hard drive (qemu) -> qcow2 -> ext4 (host)

The write performance of such a setup is awful, as a result making
the basic Ubuntu installation takes more than 15 minutes.

Using the volume makes it possible to eliminate the extra layers,
so the written data goes through

ext4 -> loop -> ext4 -> dm-linear (os-var) -> hard drive

Related-Bug: #1457643
Change-Id: Id50bbea95aced153aedf831deea15025bd69c406

subject: cobbler: pass the correct root FS URL to bootstrap nodes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-17 15:31:28.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/examples/cobbler-only.pp'], 'message': "cobbler: pass the correct root FS URL to bootstrap nodes

Cobbler passes wrong kernel command line to Ubuntu based bootstrap,
that is, it instructs the node to download the root filesystem image
from localhost. In nailgun/examples/cobbler-only.pp server gets set to
localhost, but then in each distro we set server variable manually to
fuel master IP. This was required during the time when we ran a NAT
for containers and they had some internal NATed IP using the internal
IP would break tftp. It can be removed now that we're on host networking
and replaced with the fuel master IP as usual.

Note: before the commit f01d4c6f570aa61d (`cobbler: pass root FS URL
to bootstrap kernel command line') the correspoding manifest was using
the $fuel_settings global variable (so the ip address was correct).

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Change-Id: Iabbd3673ab5b7d7530e1c3a8bf4410fa2a4de424
"}]
commit_message:
cobbler: pass the correct root FS URL to bootstrap nodes

Cobbler passes wrong kernel command line to Ubuntu based bootstrap,
that is, it instructs the node to download the root filesystem image
from localhost. In nailgun/examples/cobbler-only.pp server gets set to
localhost, but then in each distro we set server variable manually to
fuel master IP. This was required during the time when we ran a NAT
for containers and they had some internal NATed IP using the internal
IP would break tftp. It can be removed now that we're on host networking
and replaced with the fuel master IP as usual.

Note: before the commit f01d4c6f570aa61d (`cobbler: pass root FS URL
to bootstrap kernel command line') the correspoding manifest was using
the $fuel_settings global variable (so the ip address was correct).

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Change-Id: Iabbd3673ab5b7d7530e1c3a8bf4410fa2a4de424

commit_message:
cobbler: pass root FS URL to bootstrap kernel command line

The root filesystem image is stored as squashfs on the master node.
Bootstrap initramfs should know the URL to download the root FS image.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Change-Id: I00cddd5d751ff8db06da67d4aa03afe176c4ca7c

commit_message:
fuel-agent: check if lvcreate supports --yes switch

lvcreate --yes switch has been added in the recent versions of lvm2
which are not available on Ubuntu 14.04.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Add conditions for ip addr add and del

ifup event happens.

Closes-bug: #1455898

subject: Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU more robust
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 15:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['sandbox.mk'], 'message': "Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU more robust

- Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU fail if something goes wrong to prevent it from
  producing a broken chroot,
- Suppress package configuration dialogs so they don't block the build,
- Quite of postinst scripts rely on /proc. Mount /proc in the chroot
  to make those packages happy.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Change-Id: If095d6df4d901584b03b568fa62c90e0fc99974b
"}]
commit_message:
Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU more robust

- Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU fail if something goes wrong to prevent it from
  producing a broken chroot,
- Suppress package configuration dialogs so they don't block the build,
- Quite of postinst scripts rely on /proc. Mount /proc in the chroot
  to make those packages happy.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Change-Id: If095d6df4d901584b03b568fa62c90e0fc99974b

subject: SANDBOX_UBUNTU: fix APT pinning rules
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 15:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['sandbox.mk'], 'message': "SANDBOX_UBUNTU: fix APT pinning rules

The (APT) repo @ mirror.fuel-infra.org has Codename=mos6.1 instead of 'trusty',
and the repo @ obs has Codename='trusty'. SANDBOX_UBUNTU should work with
both variants.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu
Change-Id: I9df6e98d7110f853a67d22fec70dee3d77b1f2cd
"}]
commit_message:
SANDBOX_UBUNTU: fix APT pinning rules

The (APT) repo @ mirror.fuel-infra.org has Codename=mos6.1 instead of 'trusty',
and the repo @ obs has Codename='trusty'. SANDBOX_UBUNTU should work with
both variants.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu
Change-Id: I9df6e98d7110f853a67d22fec70dee3d77b1f2cd

commit_message:
packages/deb: suppress starting services in the chroot

debootstrap removes /usr/sbin/policy-rc.d, so it should be created
once more. Prevents failures like
http://jenkins-product.srt.mirantis.net:8080/view/custom_iso/job/custom_6.1_iso/1285/consoleText

Closes-Bug: #1459612
blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Change-Id: I32dd86ccf9196d0bad60487ce9168bdd01bae454

commit_message:
A more stricter check if monitor already deployed

Previously it just looked for IP and gave a false positive result, when
a controller node was removed, then added again and got the same IP.

Change-Id: Ib6eb2e21919b8fd290d9574a1fd735947761c0ff
Closes-Bug: #1473076

commit_message:
Wire in hieradata overrides via ExtraConfig for BlockStorage

Adds support for global (ExtraConfig) and role-specific
(BlockStorageExtraConfig) hiera overrides, similar to those added
for the Controller and NovaCompute roles.

Change-Id: Iaf9665b53407e6a657f56d6516469f2c88bafbdd

subject: Wire in hieradata overrides via ExtraConfig for NovaCompute
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7582, 'name': 'Jan Provaznik', 'email': 'jan.provaznik@gmail.com', 'username': 'jprovazn'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-16 15:04:20.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/compute-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Wire in hieradata overrides via ExtraConfig for NovaCompute

Adds support for global (ExtraConfig) and role-specific
(NovaComputeExtraConfig) hiera overrides, similar to those added
for the controller.

For example, you can pass an environment file like:
parameters:
  NovaComputeExtraConfig:
    nova::scheduler::filter::ram_allocation_ratio: 1.8
    compute_classes:
    - ::nova::scheduler::filter

This passes a hiera value for ram_allocation_ratio and enables
a class via the include added in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197908/

Note this also requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188772/
or 40-hiera-datafiles incorrectly quotes the list and the
compute_classes part won't work.

Change-Id: Ic33eed1b5e9c33c0d2f6075c65c8d9649b82c8b4
"}]
commit_message:
Wire in hieradata overrides via ExtraConfig for NovaCompute

Adds support for global (ExtraConfig) and role-specific
(NovaComputeExtraConfig) hiera overrides, similar to those added
for the controller.

For example, you can pass an environment file like:
parameters:
  NovaComputeExtraConfig:
    nova::scheduler::filter::ram_allocation_ratio: 1.8
    compute_classes:
    - ::nova::scheduler::filter

This passes a hiera value for ram_allocation_ratio and enables
a class via the include added in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197908/

Note this also requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188772/
or 40-hiera-datafiles incorrectly quotes the list and the
compute_classes part won't work.

Change-Id: Ic33eed1b5e9c33c0d2f6075c65c8d9649b82c8b4

commit_message:
Split Sahara to common code-base and daemon specific packages

For now Sahara has one package for all, ie common code-base
and daemon/service specific files/scripts. Now it will be splitted
into separate packages.

Partial implements: blueprint separate-sahara-package

Change-Id: I286f52662e1c689c5ca0f78f758fef544fee3ca0

commit_message:
Ensure radosgw service enabled on boot

Currently, we are not ensuring that the radowgw service is enabled to
start on boot. This change adds the radosgw service back in but only to
use the enable property.

Change-Id: I58bf4a20c9d08ba3e9624fd47e3b5780011c89b7
Closes-Bug: 1466552

commit_message:
Fix tests failing in gate

gate-cinder-python27 gate-cinder-python34 is reporting failures where it
wasn't before. This is all due to new mock version 1.1.0.  This patch
fixed the tests to pass the gate.

Some of these errors are actual errors in our test code, while other are
changes to Mock syntax.

Closes-Bug: #1473454
Change-Id: If8eabfeacacc221e92dfece9f4937875bd70751e

subject: Override grep exit code for wait_for_ca in dogtag gate
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-15 12:40:58.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/barbican'], 'message': "Override grep exit code for wait_for_ca in dogtag gate

It seems that if the dogtag gate is not up in the time that the first
sleep in the wait_for_ca function is called. The return status will be
1, and thus an exit_trap that exists in the gate script will be
executed, issuing an error when there really isn't one.

I had initially misunderstood this behaviour thinking it actually came
from the context switch that the sleep forced.

Change-Id: I000578a4b2e75673473ecd9d64c6e36ff00176c0
"}]
commit_message:
Override grep exit code for wait_for_ca in dogtag gate

It seems that if the dogtag gate is not up in the time that the first
sleep in the wait_for_ca function is called. The return status will be
1, and thus an exit_trap that exists in the gate script will be
executed, issuing an error when there really isn't one.

I had initially misunderstood this behaviour thinking it actually came
from the context switch that the sleep forced.

Change-Id: I000578a4b2e75673473ecd9d64c6e36ff00176c0

- Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU fail if something goes wrong to prevent it from
  producing a broken chroot,
- Suppress package configuration dialogs so they don't block the build,
- Quite of postinst scripts rely on /proc. Mount /proc in the chroot
  to make those packages happy.

Depends-On: I37e20b4e022ddbf946cf3b161416e1ab24e36fb3
Change-Id: I275c82ccec08f0f34d7280089a59091ce1cbfa68
"}]
commit_message:
Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU more robust

- Make SANDBOX_UBUNTU fail if something goes wrong to prevent it from
  producing a broken chroot,
- Suppress package configuration dialogs so they don't block the build,
- Quite of postinst scripts rely on /proc. Mount /proc in the chroot
  to make those packages happy.

Depends-On: I37e20b4e022ddbf946cf3b161416e1ab24e36fb3
Change-Id: I275c82ccec08f0f34d7280089a59091ce1cbfa68

commit_message:
fuelmenu: add bootstrap image settings tab

Building a bootstrap image requires an access to Ubuntu and MOS APT
repositories. The newly added settings tab allows to configure Ubuntu
and MOS mirrors, HTTP proxy, and additional APT repositories for
building the bootstrap image.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Upgrade-Impact: add BOOTSTRAP defaults to astute.yaml

Change-Id: I68f906290d28166e57c55fb5a16fb0485769dc69

subject: Restart mysql when config changed
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 425, 'name': 'Darren Birkett', 'email': 'darren.birkett@gmail.com', 'username': 'darren-birkett'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7219, 'name': 'git-harry', 'email': 'git-harry@live.co.uk', 'username': 'git-harry'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 17225, 'name': 'summer.xia.tian', 'email': 'xia.tian@99cloud.net', 'username': 'xia.tian'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-13 09:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/library/mysql_status_facts', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/galera-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_add_node.yml', 'scripts/run-aio-build.sh', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_bootstrap.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/handlers/main.yml'], 'message': "Restart mysql when config changed

Currently mysql is only (re)started when creating a cluster, adding a
node or the service isn't running. This means changes to configuration
files are not used.

This commit moves the restart functionality to a handler and sets
notifies on the the appropriate tasks so that when the config is changes
mysql is restarted.

This commit modifies the galera play to run in serial so that only one
instance of mysql can be restarted at a time. This is to prevent the
possibility of them all being restarted in one go. An additional play
'Check galera cluster status' has been added, this makes an attempt to
check that the cluster is healthy before proceeding with any possible
config changes. The checks can be overridden by setting
'galera_ignore_cluster_state=true' when running the playbook.

A facts module has been added to gather information about the status of
the cluster for use by the galera-install playbook.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1449958

Change-Id: Id83ba642c114d1f5cac04cc219be151a82a1023f
"}]
commit_message:
Restart mysql when config changed

Currently mysql is only (re)started when creating a cluster, adding a
node or the service isn't running. This means changes to configuration
files are not used.

This commit moves the restart functionality to a handler and sets
notifies on the the appropriate tasks so that when the config is changes
mysql is restarted.

This commit modifies the galera play to run in serial so that only one
instance of mysql can be restarted at a time. This is to prevent the
possibility of them all being restarted in one go. An additional play
'Check galera cluster status' has been added, this makes an attempt to
check that the cluster is healthy before proceeding with any possible
config changes. The checks can be overridden by setting
'galera_ignore_cluster_state=true' when running the playbook.

A facts module has been added to gather information about the status of
the cluster for use by the galera-install playbook.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1449958

Change-Id: Id83ba642c114d1f5cac04cc219be151a82a1023f

commit_message:
Add node_roles to VIP description

It's needed to assign VIPs to node roles other than controllers in some cases.
E.g. to install database VIP on the other node roles.
So, additional optional parameter to VIP description is introduced
to allow defining node roles to install particular VIP on.

Implements: blueprint detach-components-from-controllers
Change-Id: I7ef650a9d5f91104dd8f1ce27d84bc7016f79030

subject: Cap urllib3<1.11 in Kilo
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2799, 'name': 'Andy McCrae', 'email': 'andy.mccrae@googlemail.com', 'username': 'andrew-mccrae'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-22 03:55:09.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Cap urllib3<1.11 in Kilo

RE: The upstream PR to openstack/requirements

  - urllib3 1.11 was released today (7/21) and now python-glanceclient
    0.17.2 is blowing up in the kilo side of grenade with AttributeErrors,
    and glanceclient uses requests which I believe is what's pulling in the
    urllib3 regression.

This change unbreaks the Kilo Gate

Change-Id: I9f221ed68eb27e04d683fe5130a835886f9a092a
Related-Bug: #1476770
"}]
commit_message:
Cap urllib3<1.11 in Kilo

RE: The upstream PR to openstack/requirements

  - urllib3 1.11 was released today (7/21) and now python-glanceclient
    0.17.2 is blowing up in the kilo side of grenade with AttributeErrors,
    and glanceclient uses requests which I believe is what's pulling in the
    urllib3 regression.

This change unbreaks the Kilo Gate

Change-Id: I9f221ed68eb27e04d683fe5130a835886f9a092a
Related-Bug: #1476770

It looks like udev rule content is being delivered in a middle of

commit_message:
[IBP] fix 'udevd: can not read' errors again

It looks like udev rule content is being delivered in a middle of
blacklisting routine. Adding sync in order to be sure that data is
written on disk.

Change-Id: I2613777b367fe29b5e35f06e00fdb9a644498cfc
Closes-Bug: #1422717

commit_message:
Increase default start timeout for Pacemaker from 20s to 90s

On slow environments the start operation of some services can
take longer than 20s so we increase the default for start
operation to 90s, more info can be found at:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1242052

Systemd defaults to 90s as well.

Change-Id: Ie4652bad518075be77937d47830f263034eda79c

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-20 18:11:28.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/testrail/report.py'], 'message': "Avoiding an extra gap in the name of a test plan

In fuel-qa/fuelweb_test/testrail/report.py we have the following code
block http://paste.mirantis.net/show/769/. If the prefix variable is '',
the name of a test plan will have an extra gap. So other scripts (for
example, report_tempest_results.py), that publish some test results to
TestRail, always create new test plan because they try to find the name
of the test plan without the gap. That causes duplicating test plans and
that is very inconvenient for users.

Closes-Bug: #1476327

Change-Id: I1c087e835e63db4828fafb3b936f7ace2d4eb29d
"}]
commit_message:
Avoiding an extra gap in the name of a test plan

In fuel-qa/fuelweb_test/testrail/report.py we have the following code
block http://paste.mirantis.net/show/769/. If the prefix variable is '',
the name of a test plan will have an extra gap. So other scripts (for
example, report_tempest_results.py), that publish some test results to
TestRail, always create new test plan because they try to find the name
of the test plan without the gap. That causes duplicating test plans and
that is very inconvenient for users.

Closes-Bug: #1476327

Change-Id: I1c087e835e63db4828fafb3b936f7ace2d4eb29d

commit_message:
Do not add @domain_name to dnsmasq.conf if it equals 'local'

Currently dnsmasq tries to resolve locally a host named
test.mydomain.local instead of forwarding this request to the local dns
server.

Change-Id: I5892fddaffa0dc619f0a54ac0f9fac34055b9b3f
Closes-Bug: 1411425
(cherry picked from commit 3ca3ef5aae68b84ec8b9beb55e552bdd70d42599)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-27 14:07:39.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/horizon/templates/local_settings.py.erb'], 'message': 'Hardcode the location of Horizon policy files on CentOS

By default Horizon looks for these files in ROOT_PATH/conf,
which is a symlink to [1] on CentOS. This results in displaying
unusable elements supposed to be shown only for administrator, without
listing objects that user has no access to.

[1] /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py

Change-Id: I4e862384ec9c435ec7077633c8254c1c9f547b10
Closes-Bug: 1397069
(cherry picked from commit 2a46295071fed165bea78efe1d1a1a62488a5a65)
'}]
commit_message:
Hardcode the location of Horizon policy files on CentOS

By default Horizon looks for these files in ROOT_PATH/conf,
which is a symlink to [1] on CentOS. This results in displaying
unusable elements supposed to be shown only for administrator, without
listing objects that user has no access to.

[1] /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py

Change-Id: I4e862384ec9c435ec7077633c8254c1c9f547b10
Closes-Bug: 1397069
(cherry picked from commit 2a46295071fed165bea78efe1d1a1a62488a5a65)

subject: Set nova's default_floating_pool
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9410, 'name': 'Yanis Guenane', 'email': 'yguenane@redhat.com', 'username': 'yguenane'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 15:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Set nova's default_floating_pool

This is needed for `nova floating-ip-create` command to work without
specifying a particular external network. Probably not a big deal for
end users (usually you'd want to pick the network you want, and
e.g. `neutron floatingip-create` won't allow autoselection). However,
tempest depends on this functionality, so we should have it.

The value is specified in hiera (even though it's not a class parameter),
so that users can override it via ExtraConfig if need be.

Change-Id: I3967e0b8554482b34d089574fe028d2c7caaf669
"}]
commit_message:
Set nova's default_floating_pool

This is needed for `nova floating-ip-create` command to work without
specifying a particular external network. Probably not a big deal for
end users (usually you'd want to pick the network you want, and
e.g. `neutron floatingip-create` won't allow autoselection). However,
tempest depends on this functionality, so we should have it.

The value is specified in hiera (even though it's not a class parameter),
so that users can override it via ExtraConfig if need be.

Change-Id: I3967e0b8554482b34d089574fe028d2c7caaf669

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-22 17:41:34.000000000', 'files': ['elements/simple-init/install.d/simple-init.sh'], 'message': 'Dont fail simple-init without ssh installed

Ubuntu-minimal does not install openssh, but simple-init.sh expects it
to be there. Lets not fail if its missing.

Change-Id: I8585c6d0349413b2129a751a1e54e4e5734cb8fb

commit_message:
Dont fail simple-init without ssh installed

Ubuntu-minimal does not install openssh, but simple-init.sh expects it
to be there. Lets not fail if its missing.

Change-Id: I8585c6d0349413b2129a751a1e54e4e5734cb8fb

commit_message:
Add support hypermetro for huawei volume driver

Hypermetro is a key storage feature and a requirement for features
such as high-availability and disaster recovery of applications
running on top of OpenStack clouds. This blueprint is an attempt
to add initial support for volume hypermetro in Huawei volume driver.

Change-Id: I3d12d8766f617cc55afa0e08e028110e0993f1bd
Implements: blueprint support-hypermetro-for-huawei-volume-driver

Removing archaic references

This document was originally imported from Nova. Removing some of the
old references to Quickstart and Hypervisors.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/cinder/devref/development.environment.html
has a dangling link to a ../quickstart document (removed long ago.)

commit_message:
Neutron VxLAN support

The patch changes GRE in UI and Nailgun to more generic
TUN segmentation type, letting fuel-library decide what tunnels
to use (VxLAN will be used by default in 7.0)

Implements: blueprint neutron-vxlan-support

Change-Id: Ifa63b7f149dfa021aa5898674bc16c1955cdb787
Co-Authored-By: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.service library

Modules eventlet_backdoor, loopingcall, periodic_task,
service, sslutils, systemd, threadgroup were removed
from nova. These modules were imported from oslo.service
library.

Co-Authored-By: Marian Horban <mhorban@mirantis.com>
Depends-On: I305cf53bad6213c151395e93d656b53a8a28e1db
Change-Id: Iaef67e16af3d69f845742f7bdcb43667bf1576ee

This patch allows the list_resource_types() API to return a list of
dict where each dict contains the actual resource type representation.
It is proposed to make Heat conform to the API-WG recommendation:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/representation_structure.html#collection-resources

'}]
commit_message:
Allow list_resource_types return a list of dict

This patch allows the list_resource_types() API to return a list of
dict where each dict contains the actual resource type representation.
It is proposed to make Heat conform to the API-WG recommendation:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/representation_structure.html#collection-resources
It also help remove the gate barrier to get resource type list patch
tested (patch here: https://review.openstack.org/147761/)

Change-Id: Icba48326b2f1286d55701a93f9c637eec508677b

commit_message:
Remove HOT Reference Guide from docs.openstack.org

As per https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1461720,
the HOT Guide has been moved from the User Guide in the
openstack-manuals repo to the Template Guide in the Heat repo.

The Template Guide maintains a HOT reference chapter
(http://docs.openstack.org/developer/heat/template_guide/openstack.html)
that duplicates the HOT Reference guide
(http://docs.openstack.org/hot-reference/content/).
As such, it makes sense to remove the HOT Reference guide from
docs.openstack.org.

* remove hot-reference guide
* remove HOT Reference hyperlink from index
* update /www/static/.htaccess, redirect link

Closes-Bug: #1469606

Change-Id: Ie2240d2fca5d6e43b1d186645e7ff9107514f289

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-06-16 15:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Let soft-deleted instance_system_metadata readable

Currently, We can't delete instance system metadata after instance
is deleted because of following reason:
1) We might have 'changed-since' request which will access
the soft deleted system_metadata
2) We might has period audit function which also access the
soft deleted system_metadata

The root cause is the join function filtered the 'deleted'
data of system metadata and it lead to ValueError later.

Conceptually the system metadata is associated with instance,
it will be used in instance's lifecycle, the data will only
be updated so we won't have 2 copies or more system_metadata
for the same instance.
So allow to read it even if it's deleted is safe.

This patch load the system_metadata from db when instance is
in deleted state to avoid can't delete system_metadata issue.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ifd8d2c91879834d3759aafdb036dac209a246d1b
Partial-Bug: #1226049
"}]
commit_message:
Let soft-deleted instance_system_metadata readable

Currently, We can't delete instance system metadata after instance
is deleted because of following reason:
1) We might have 'changed-since' request which will access
the soft deleted system_metadata
2) We might has period audit function which also access the
soft deleted system_metadata

The root cause is the join function filtered the 'deleted'
data of system metadata and it lead to ValueError later.

Conceptually the system metadata is associated with instance,
it will be used in instance's lifecycle, the data will only
be updated so we won't have 2 copies or more system_metadata
for the same instance.
So allow to read it even if it's deleted is safe.

This patch load the system_metadata from db when instance is
in deleted state to avoid can't delete system_metadata issue.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ifd8d2c91879834d3759aafdb036dac209a246d1b
Partial-Bug: #1226049

commit_message:
Use url to check if ODL is fully initialized

With this change, releases of ODL that provide a url to know when
its fully operational will not need to unconditionally wait for
ODL_BOOT_WAIT before proceeding.

Note that in Kilo the lib function test_with_retry does not exist.
Thus, we create odl_test_with_retry.

Change-Id: I1a6fa4619489944b210586386bc3496c1cef26a1
(cherry picked from commit fab09304a11f1803a3fc98ec6c9512cf79038e42)

commit_message:
Switch default pattern in create-zanata-xml.py

It turns out the Zanata client applies patterns relative to the
project root, and not the src-dir that is configured in zanata.xml.
Change the default pattern to be **/*.pot.

Change-Id: Ifbe76588b85a4226253617ff8b723410d05de36c

commit_message:
Bump lower/upper constraint of futurist to newly released 0.1.2

Oslo.messaging and taskflow (and others) would like to take advantage
of functionality added into futurist in the 0.1.2 release so adjust
the needed version bounds to make that possible.

Change-Id: Ifd7b6e11863cae3d34fd5475a364ebb7c28811fc

Change-Id: I8f493f720c479fd84b1a554ee5196115b992ecd1

commit_message:
Sort metric data before grouping and processing

In gnocchi dispatcher, metric data will be grouped by resource_id and
counter_name before processing. But the inputted data is an unordered
list. It is better being sorted by resource_id and counter_name before
processing.

Change-Id: I8f493f720c479fd84b1a554ee5196115b992ecd1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2475, 'name': 'Antoine Musso', 'email': 'hashar@free.fr', 'username': 'hashar'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 16272, 'name': 'Clint Adams', 'email': 'clint@gcfm.net', 'username': 'clint'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-09 12:01:24.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debian/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'debian: install DHCP client and ifconfig packages

When building an image having the elements debian and vm, cloud-init
fails with:

    ci-info: !!!!!!!!Net device info failed!!!!!!!!

Looking at the source code, it executes ifconfig to gather informations
but the `debian` elements does not provide it.  There is also no DHCP
client available which is rather painful.

Install isc-dhcp-client to provide a DHCP client.
Install net-tools to provide ifconfig, required by cloud-init.

Ref: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T105152
Change-Id: I76dfd4f87a5c9f08e7c572fb4f5ebeeb34f5f66a
'}]
commit_message:
debian: install DHCP client and ifconfig packages

When building an image having the elements debian and vm, cloud-init
fails with:

    ci-info: !!!!!!!!Net device info failed!!!!!!!!

Looking at the source code, it executes ifconfig to gather informations
but the `debian` elements does not provide it.  There is also no DHCP
client available which is rather painful.

Install isc-dhcp-client to provide a DHCP client.
Install net-tools to provide ifconfig, required by cloud-init.

Ref: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T105152
Change-Id: I76dfd4f87a5c9f08e7c572fb4f5ebeeb34f5f66a

commit_message:
Fixed incorrect dhcp_server value during nova-network creation

When parameter dhcp_server is None, we must use network gateway
for each network. But because of incorrect usage of variable
dhcp_server, we use gateway of the FIRST network for each network.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1443970

Change-Id: I9d22a2ac94e8675a231436ce8ba77260c4b8b98a
(cherry picked from commit f697befdd3a0f9b81ff9a74f55e4460cd3783692)

commit_message:
Moved the contents related to DataDrivenTests to a new directory

1. Created a new directory called 'ddt' to hold all the data
driven tests so that they could be scheduled to run independently
of the other tests.

2. Common functionalities used across the data driven tests
including  various resource setups and operating status checks
have been gathered up under v2/ddt/base_ddt.py file. (Earlier,
I made it a part of v2/api/base.py. Now, it's been pulled out to
the 'ddt' directory.)

The gate-tempest-dsvm-docker job fails most of the time on nova changes
and nobody from the nova-docker project is monitoring the job, so the

commit_message:
Remove gate-tempest-dsvm-docker from nova's check queue

The gate-tempest-dsvm-docker job fails most of the time on nova changes
and nobody from the nova-docker project is monitoring the job, so the
nova team wants it removed from the check queue for nova changes.

This was discussed at the nova liberty midcycle meetup.

Change-Id: Ic8eae3b73601518616f9a32236663865024e76cd

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3211, 'name': 'zhangjialong', 'email': 'zhangjl@awcloud.com', 'username': 'zhangjl'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 8846, 'name': 'Hao Wang', 'display_name': 'Hao Wang', 'email': 'sxmatch1986@gmail.com', 'username': 'sxmatch'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10224, 'name': 'Feodor Tersin', 'email': 'ftersin@hotmail.com', 'username': 'ftersin'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12175, 'name': 'Eli Qiao', 'email': 'qiaoliyong@gmail.com', 'username': 'Eli'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-17 10:21:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "BDM: Stop booting if a blank volume as boot device

If booting an instance with block_device_mapping_v2 with follow command:
--block-device source=blank,dest=volume,device=vda,size=2
nova will only create one block device as boot device without local temporary
disk, even we can see from the request body we pass 2 block device mapping:
{u'source_type': u'image', u'destination_type': u'local', u'boot_index': 0,...}
{u'source_type': u'blank', u'destination_type': u'volume', ...
 u'device_name': u'vda'}
this command line is incorrect which should be refused.
Closed-Bug: #1449858
Change-Id: Ie50be8a2e4f6aaaac0f422bef5c4fd66dabe8b42
"}]
commit_message:
BDM: Stop booting if a blank volume as boot device

If booting an instance with block_device_mapping_v2 with follow command:
--block-device source=blank,dest=volume,device=vda,size=2
nova will only create one block device as boot device without local temporary
disk, even we can see from the request body we pass 2 block device mapping:
{u'source_type': u'image', u'destination_type': u'local', u'boot_index': 0,...}
{u'source_type': u'blank', u'destination_type': u'volume', ...
 u'device_name': u'vda'}
this command line is incorrect which should be refused.
Closed-Bug: #1449858
Change-Id: Ie50be8a2e4f6aaaac0f422bef5c4fd66dabe8b42

commit_message:
Remove py26 from tox

The Python 2.6 testing has been deprecated for some time, and is
removed from gate https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201105/.

This patch removes py26 from tox conf so that developers will not
end up testing py26.

Co-Authored-By: Sirushti Murugesan <sirushti.murugesan@hp.com>

Change-Id: Id2698c892db07278f47dea54360e8a0c4dad6981
Closes-Bug: #1474686
