revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-20 00:55:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Added functional tests for L3 schedulers.

Legacy mode agents considered.

Following test cases are added:
Common scenarios:
1. No routers scheduled if no agents are present
2. No routers scheduled if it is already hosted
3. No routers scheduled if all agents are down
4. Router scheduled to the agent if router is not yet hosted
5. Router scheduled to the agent even if it already hosts a router

Following scenario specific to least routers scheduler is added:
1. Router is scheduled to agent hosting least routers

For each of Chance and Least Router schedulers auto scheduling is also verified.

A total of 22 test cases are added.

Change-Id: Ic4df299bac83c80abf0890a81d2dd36d15993b33
'}]
commit_message:
Added functional tests for L3 schedulers.

Legacy mode agents considered.

Following test cases are added:
Common scenarios:
1. No routers scheduled if no agents are present
2. No routers scheduled if it is already hosted
3. No routers scheduled if all agents are down
4. Router scheduled to the agent if router is not yet hosted
5. Router scheduled to the agent even if it already hosts a router

Following scenario specific to least routers scheduler is added:
1. Router is scheduled to agent hosting least routers

For each of Chance and Least Router schedulers auto scheduling is also verified.

A total of 22 test cases are added.

Change-Id: Ic4df299bac83c80abf0890a81d2dd36d15993b33

commit_message:
Huawei driver support storage pools

Change create_share function: Modify the get pool name method from
huawei configuration file to use manila.share.utils.extract_host
function.
Change update_share_stats function: One huawei backend can report
many pools.

subject: Add NetworkChoiceField to Dynamic UI
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7226, 'name': 'Stan Lagun', 'email': 'stan.lagun@gmail.com', 'username': 'istalker2'}, {'_account_id': 7535, 'name': 'Nikolay Starodubtsev', 'email': 'starodubcevna@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kezar'}, {'_account_id': 7549, 'name': 'Ekaterina Chernova', 'email': 'katyafervent@yandex.ru', 'username': 'efedorova'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 13962, 'name': 'Victor Ryzhenkin', 'email': 'vryzhenkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vryzhenkin'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-07-21 11:05:50.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/common/net.py', 'muranodashboard/dynamic_ui/forms.py', 'muranodashboard/dynamic_ui/fields.py', 'muranodashboard/dynamic_ui/version.py'], 'message': 'Add NetworkChoiceField to Dynamic UI

Sometimes a VM should be placed to an existing network rather then to a
new network created during deployment. While our workflows support this,
there is no way for the end user to select such a network in the UI.

This patch adds a new type of the field for Murano Dynamic UI:
NetworkChoiseField. This field provides a selection of networks and
their subnetworks as a dropdown pupulated with those which are available
to the current tenant.

When the user selects an item in this list the IDs of selected network
and subnet are returned by the control and thus may passed to the
engine along with the rest of the ObjectModel, so the newly created
instances join the specified net and subnet.

The control has a default option ("Auto"): if it is selected the
returned tuple contains Null, so the ObjectModel may be constructed in a
default way. This option may be disabled by the field parameter, so
package developers may use this field to oblige the user to select some
network.

Field has some other parameters, which allow to filter the available
networks: pick only the networks matching the specific regex, exclude
murano-generated networks or replace murano-generated names with
human-readable ones.

As this new field adds new functionality to the Dynamic UI platform,
it also bumps up a minor version of the format version to 2.1.

Implements Blueprint ui-network-selection
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af
'}]
commit_message:
Add NetworkChoiceField to Dynamic UI

Sometimes a VM should be placed to an existing network rather then to a
new network created during deployment. While our workflows support this,
there is no way for the end user to select such a network in the UI.

This patch adds a new type of the field for Murano Dynamic UI:
NetworkChoiseField. This field provides a selection of networks and
their subnetworks as a dropdown pupulated with those which are available
to the current tenant.

When the user selects an item in this list the IDs of selected network
and subnet are returned by the control and thus may passed to the
engine along with the rest of the ObjectModel, so the newly created
instances join the specified net and subnet.

The control has a default option ("Auto"): if it is selected the
returned tuple contains Null, so the ObjectModel may be constructed in a
default way. This option may be disabled by the field parameter, so
package developers may use this field to oblige the user to select some
network.

Field has some other parameters, which allow to filter the available
networks: pick only the networks matching the specific regex, exclude
murano-generated networks or replace murano-generated names with
human-readable ones.

As this new field adds new functionality to the Dynamic UI platform,
it also bumps up a minor version of the format version to 2.1.

Implements Blueprint ui-network-selection
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie256c36523c67f27e4cb0b7c9aeed76b2abd28af

commit_message:
Add Trove plugin

Sometimes Fuel user wants to extend Fuel to install Trove
plugin. Right now user changes the code of Fuel services rebuilds
and adds repositories maanually.

The current approach causes a problem:
* user has to apply all patches manually after Fuel upgraded.

blueprint support-trove

Change-Id: Ibaa588d25c43cee340b6dec7e6e20558e2497205

subject: Set umask to 0022 for OCF scripts that add network namespaces
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 18:20:31.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ns_IPaddr2', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ns_haproxy'], 'message': 'Set umask to 0022 for OCF scripts that add network namespaces

When ns_haproxy or ns_IPaddr2 create the first network namespace
/var/run/netns will have permissions of 751 due to the umask
being 0026 at that time. This will cause the problems with
Neutron agents described in the referenced bug.

Change-Id: Ib8d1f485272ef843e935f43b1b40d7db6b0c2e78
Closes-bug: #1414239
'}]
commit_message:
Set umask to 0022 for OCF scripts that add network namespaces

When ns_haproxy or ns_IPaddr2 create the first network namespace
/var/run/netns will have permissions of 751 due to the umask
being 0026 at that time. This will cause the problems with
Neutron agents described in the referenced bug.

Change-Id: Ib8d1f485272ef843e935f43b1b40d7db6b0c2e78
Closes-bug: #1414239

commit_message:
Make rescheduling of l3 agent more resilient

In order to make l3 agent restart more resilient
and idempotent do:

1) delete agent after resource is stopped and
all the stuff is cleaned up

2) reschedule not only dead routers/networks but also
orphaned routers/networks

3) enclose get_pid_list_for_ns_list function argument
in cleanup function into double quoutes
or it will use only the first argument
and will not work with several networks

(cherry picked from commit 9f45b83f8e9ae7715058bc42e5f7ca20a10d55aa)

Related-Bug: #1371550
Related-Bug: #1375817
Change-Id: I90338ff2df2703e121a6075ad1e60a442c88591f

commit_message:
Cap urllib3<1.11 in stable/kilo

urllib3 1.11 was released today (7/21) and now python-glanceclient
0.17.2 is blowing up in the kilo side of grenade with AttributeErrors,
and glanceclient uses requests which I believe is what's pulling in the
urllib3 regression.

Related-Bug: #1476770
Depends-On: I106b92a9c48f414f87a36e359aea3fbaf273fcef
Change-Id: I1707bfa1b1a5afeb4995c374682ae67e3d4b79ea

commit_message:
Moved user_group_vars to defaults

The change moves the user_group_vars.yml from openstack_deploy/ to
a standard default file. This will allow a deployer to override items
in the file while also allowing development to make changes to the file
that may impact its contents. When the file was moved out it was short
sighted to move it into 100% userspace and should have simply become the
main default file.

Change-Id: Icfc3efea0a43d55b5a23bca2f64d4d6d73542d10
Related-Bug: #1460516

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 23:51:07.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Added openstack_kernel options for gc_thresh

This commit adds to the openstack_kernel_options to set the
"net.ipv4/6.neigh.default.gc_thresh*" values according to the set_gc_val
which has a default value of 8192

The changes here should provide for a more scalable neutron networking
environment by default while also ensuring that the values computed are sane.
Additionally, should the user want to define their own `set_gc_val` they can do
so by simply overriding the `set_gc_val` variable.

Change-Id: Ic5fd7ebdac009fa1472aeb0b0666f9b2611a31d7
Closes-Bug: #1427893
'}]
commit_message:
Added openstack_kernel options for gc_thresh

This commit adds to the openstack_kernel_options to set the
"net.ipv4/6.neigh.default.gc_thresh*" values according to the set_gc_val
which has a default value of 8192

The changes here should provide for a more scalable neutron networking
environment by default while also ensuring that the values computed are sane.
Additionally, should the user want to define their own `set_gc_val` they can do
so by simply overriding the `set_gc_val` variable.

Change-Id: Ic5fd7ebdac009fa1472aeb0b0666f9b2611a31d7
Closes-Bug: #1427893

commit_message:
Update requirements for Anchor

Update cryptography and ldap3 module so Anchor can start using the
global-requirements.
cryptography needed to be bumped due to new required APIs.
ldap3 has been added since python-ldap does not support python3. ldap3
is an LGPL module which works in both py2 and py3.

Co-Authored-By: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
Change-Id: I506449d0db1371aeda460786ab92632e97de3a5c

commit_message:
Workaround for run mysql_create_db if folder /var/lib/mysql exists

Our code creates this folder to mount into it partition that will be used for MySQL.
If Package see that folder exists, so mysql_create_db will not be runned.
Implements: blueprint lsi-raid-controllers

Change-Id: I2690f91113adcb932a20ec255ac66e0a625945ef

subject: Change Cinder storage options from checkbox to radio
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8787, 'name': 'Dmitry Borodaenko', 'email': 'angdraug@gmail.com', 'username': 'angdraug'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-28 20:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/examples/site.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_ha.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_simple.pp'], 'message': 'Change Cinder storage options from checkbox to radio

Until fuel-cinder-multi-backend blueprint is implemented, an OpenStack
environment can have only one Cinder storage backend. Having checkboxes for
both LVM and Ceph provides user with options that are not really supported by
Fuel, such as having both or none of the backends selected.

This commit depends on a matching change in fuel-web to change storage options
for Cinder from checkboxes to radio buttons.

Change-Id: I6b912e3ee2cbb5c3cb4b75c8378c59303b159376
Partial-Bug: #1323555
'}]
commit_message:
Change Cinder storage options from checkbox to radio

Until fuel-cinder-multi-backend blueprint is implemented, an OpenStack
environment can have only one Cinder storage backend. Having checkboxes for
both LVM and Ceph provides user with options that are not really supported by
Fuel, such as having both or none of the backends selected.

This commit depends on a matching change in fuel-web to change storage options
for Cinder from checkboxes to radio buttons.

Change-Id: I6b912e3ee2cbb5c3cb4b75c8378c59303b159376
Partial-Bug: #1323555

commit_message:
Remove munging of translation interpolation

This patch removes the transformation of interpolation
markers in translation strings from {$ foo $} to %(foo)
since the former is required by angular-gettext to operate.

Change-Id: I3d42a7fc94571f88dda77eded1eeb0b1d9955979

subject: Fix general upgrade issues for Juno > Kilo
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-18 17:50:44.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Fix general upgrade issues for Juno > Kilo

This change adds a container task to ensure that container networks are up
and using the new configs as written by the lxc-container-create play. This
should resolve an issue where the container networks could be in a down
state after an upgrade due to a configuration file change.

A run function was also added to make it possible for a deployer to know
where in the upgrade process something might have failed and the order in
which the tasks may need to be rerun to continue the upgrade.

Change-Id: If02c4e269375368b6f613c5a9e3c947dddbd27f9
Closes-Bug: #1474585
Partial-Bug: #1475727
'}]
commit_message:
Fix general upgrade issues for Juno > Kilo

This change adds a container task to ensure that container networks are up
and using the new configs as written by the lxc-container-create play. This
should resolve an issue where the container networks could be in a down
state after an upgrade due to a configuration file change.

A run function was also added to make it possible for a deployer to know
where in the upgrade process something might have failed and the order in
which the tasks may need to be rerun to continue the upgrade.

Change-Id: If02c4e269375368b6f613c5a9e3c947dddbd27f9
Closes-Bug: #1474585
Partial-Bug: #1475727

commit_message:
Adding model and data_model changes to support active/standby topology

1. Create value tables for: lb topology, and amphora roles.
2. Add a topology column to the load_balancer table.
3. Add a role column to the amphora table.
4. Functional tests.

Change-Id: I83c7ee315158bc2402c340ef58474ff6ef0be1b6

commit_message:
Remove **most** usage of taskflow.utils in examples

It appears folks are using the taskflow.utils code in there own
code-bases (likely taking it from the examples) which we do not
want to encourage, so remove the usage of **most** of
taskflow.utils code from the examples so that people are less
likely to copy/paste/reference it.

Change-Id: I0ce3c520de347e3e746e7912aa1366a515458424

commit_message:
Fix logical port delete

The logical ports were not deleted as they were referenced
from the logical switch table and OVSDB failed
to issue the transaction.

This fixes this by also removing the port from the logical
switch.

Change-Id: Idc0d27248d5ac02b904babf1cec2fb7dce402b0e

commit_message:
Remove docker-py so docker-compose can grab the right version

Docker compose will fail with a version error if docker-py
is not 1.2.3.  Using >= 1.2.0 will get docker-py 1.3.0 causing
compose to fail.

Change-Id: I54ba1fe95b9c7a5a242b8339e153fbee80ff6c3b
Closes-Bug: #1473856

In reality VIPs do not depend on haproxy, haproxy depends on VIPs

commit_message:
Change pacemaker colocation for haproxy and VIPs

In reality VIPs do not depend on haproxy, haproxy depends on VIPs
and If we restart haproxy it should not effect VIPs.

Change-Id: Id16add80808aef9549bb83d03da3c06d64978b38
Closes-bug: #1456169

subject: Remove RDO dependency from source images
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 10419, 'name': 'Ryan Hallisey', 'email': 'rhallise@redhat.com', 'username': 'rhallisey'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-21 17:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['docker/centos/source/base/Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Remove RDO dependency from source images

It turns out the only dependencies we need from RDO in the source builds
are python-pip, python-cliff for crux, and crudini, all of which can be
pulled from pypi.

We should remove the dependency on RDO for these builds which is one of
the reasons for source builds in the first place.

Change-Id: I11e26e96e6c94a5df5db48204714229bbd85a9aa
Closes-Bug: #1476760
'}]
commit_message:
Remove RDO dependency from source images

It turns out the only dependencies we need from RDO in the source builds
are python-pip, python-cliff for crux, and crudini, all of which can be
pulled from pypi.

We should remove the dependency on RDO for these builds which is one of
the reasons for source builds in the first place.

Change-Id: I11e26e96e6c94a5df5db48204714229bbd85a9aa
Closes-Bug: #1476760

commit_message:
Mocked API tests

Added '-m' option to run_tests.sh. This avoids setting up the Nailgun API
server and runs only tests marked as 'mocked_api' which speeds up unit testing.

Change-Id: I4abda654de890f7ec193bf5bef69781245ce82b5

commit_message:
Add install script support for plugins

In some cases, plugins will need to be able to run install scripts. This
 adds the ability to specify an 'install_script' in the metadata to run
 during install

Change-Id: Ieaf2f8e0f208176b39f6de3d098a4675e853dd70
Closes-bug: 1395228

commit_message:
Cap urllib3<1.11 in stable/kilo for grenade

urllib3 1.11 was released today (7/21) and now python-glanceclient
0.17.2 is blowing up in the kilo side of grenade with AttributeErrors,
and glanceclient uses requests which I believe is what's pulling in the
urllib3 regression.

Related-Bug: #1476770

Change-Id: I11b8d26ff4a6c63fcab8a12db3a6fddcbc91186c

commit_message:
Add retry logic to CNA update

The update of the CNA pvid is critical to getting the VM online.
The feed of CNAs is done up front and then looped over periodically.
However, there may be times when the CNA obtained from the feed is not
the absolute current by the time that the agent attempts to update it.
In these scenarios the API throws a 'etag' error.

This change set adds logic surrounding this to make sure that the API
can get the latest CNA and attempt the update again.

Change-Id: Ie31cb3c81c3bedb112f9866da7d683b780482648

commit_message:
New projects have to meet all existing policies.

Also be clearer that the gate we want has to be on the OpenStack
infra, not in some random other place, and finally, move the ability
to make new repos from being a 'requirement' to being separate prose.

Change-Id: I38e545f8539195d79d6dfb42a8ec0d8eca435ccd

With this change, we're defining new setup methodology
for container based virt (parallels now, and in future LXC too).
In such environments the *host* container technology will be
responsible for mounting the config drive image inside the guest
filesystem. So when the guest image boots, it will see the config
drive data immediately at the location defined by cloud-init.
The only demand for existing images is having cloud-init turned on.

To support config drive in Virtuozzo (former PCS) containers,
we use ploop block device. Actions with ploop device are performed
via ploop CLI tool and newly created device is mounted into
/var/lib/cloud/seed/config_drive on container's filesystem.

commit_message:
Add config drive support for Virtuozzo containers

With this change, we're defining new setup methodology
for container based virt (parallels now, and in future LXC too).
In such environments the *host* container technology will be
responsible for mounting the config drive image inside the guest
filesystem. So when the guest image boots, it will see the config
drive data immediately at the location defined by cloud-init.
The only demand for existing images is having cloud-init turned on.

To support config drive in Virtuozzo (former PCS) containers,
we use ploop block device. Actions with ploop device are performed
via ploop CLI tool and newly created device is mounted into
/var/lib/cloud/seed/config_drive on container's filesystem.
This destination recognised by cloud-init as a source of data.

(Ploop device description: https://openvz.org/Ploop)

Co-Authored-By: Maxim Nestratov <mnestratov@parallels.com>

Change-Id: Ib21ab954a08027fb1f2aec13c2d95b5f080eccce
Implements: blueprint config-drive-support-for-virtuozzo

subject: Fix Horizon SSL certificate management and distribution
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 12:20:24.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_horizon/templates/openstack_dashboard.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/horizon_ssl_key_store.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/horizon_ssl_key_distribute.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/horizon_ssl_user_provided.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/horizon_ssl_key_create.yml'], 'message': "Fix Horizon SSL certificate management and distribution

This patch revises the SSL certificate management and
distribution with something that is more consistent with how
it's done everywhere else in the project. It also repairs the
current user provided certificate distribution which was broken.

* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all horizon containers.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - horizon_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - horizon_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on the first Horizon container and
  distributed to the other containers.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - horizon_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* A new variable called 'horizon_ssl_self_signed_subject' has
  been implemented to allow the user to override the self-signed
  certificate properties, such as the CN and subjectAltName.

Upgrade notes:

* The Apache configuration appropriately implements the
  'SSLCACertificateFile' instead of the 'SSLCACertificatePath'
  directive in order to ensure that the appropriate signing
  certificate is provided to the browser.

* The variable 'horizon_self_signed' (which defaulted to true)
  has been removed. The decision of whether to generate a
  self-signed certificate has been made based on whether a
  user provided key/cert pair has been provided.

* The 'horizon_self_signed_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'horizon_ssl_self_signed_regen'.

* The default names for the deployed keys/certificates have been
  changed:
  - /etc/ssl/certs/apache.cert  > /etc/ssl/certs/horizon.pem
  - /etc/ssl/private/apache.key > /etc/ssl/private/horizon.key

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1475578

Change-Id: I7089abbd81ce422b21ce65488e8bc32053ba32ca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Horizon SSL certificate management and distribution

This patch revises the SSL certificate management and
distribution with something that is more consistent with how
it's done everywhere else in the project. It also repairs the
current user provided certificate distribution which was broken.

* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all horizon containers.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - horizon_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - horizon_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on the first Horizon container and
  distributed to the other containers.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - horizon_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* A new variable called 'horizon_ssl_self_signed_subject' has
  been implemented to allow the user to override the self-signed
  certificate properties, such as the CN and subjectAltName.

Upgrade notes:

* The Apache configuration appropriately implements the
  'SSLCACertificateFile' instead of the 'SSLCACertificatePath'
  directive in order to ensure that the appropriate signing
  certificate is provided to the browser.

* The variable 'horizon_self_signed' (which defaulted to true)
  has been removed. The decision of whether to generate a
  self-signed certificate has been made based on whether a
  user provided key/cert pair has been provided.

* The 'horizon_self_signed_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'horizon_ssl_self_signed_regen'.

* The default names for the deployed keys/certificates have been
  changed:
  - /etc/ssl/certs/apache.cert  > /etc/ssl/certs/horizon.pem
  - /etc/ssl/private/apache.key > /etc/ssl/private/horizon.key

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1475578

Change-Id: I7089abbd81ce422b21ce65488e8bc32053ba32ca

subject: Make ini-config handle file in directory without write perms
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7662, 'name': 'Rob Crittenden', 'email': 'rcritten@redhat.com', 'username': 'rcritten'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-16 01:36:02.000000000', 'files': ['inc/ini-config', 'tests/test_ini_config.sh'], 'message': 'Make ini-config handle file in directory without write perms

The top of the ini munging file says it is a stand-alone library, so
it seems like it should "just work" with files that you own that
happen to live in directories you don't, such as /etc.

"sed -i" will try to write out a sibling file as part of the in-place
fixup, which will fail in such a case.  This leaves us with either
workarounds or having to run the whole thing under sudo.

This change modifies ini-config to always work on a temporary file
when editing.  Additionally we add some clarity around missing file
behaviour.  The test-case is updated to simulate this situation.

Change-Id: Ib7556dac9aaaf2f3c96237e0ca28ed6ae1b1b7ac
'}]
commit_message:
Make ini-config handle file in directory without write perms

The top of the ini munging file says it is a stand-alone library, so
it seems like it should "just work" with files that you own that
happen to live in directories you don't, such as /etc.

"sed -i" will try to write out a sibling file as part of the in-place
fixup, which will fail in such a case.  This leaves us with either
workarounds or having to run the whole thing under sudo.

This change modifies ini-config to always work on a temporary file
when editing.  Additionally we add some clarity around missing file
behaviour.  The test-case is updated to simulate this situation.

Change-Id: Ib7556dac9aaaf2f3c96237e0ca28ed6ae1b1b7ac

commit_message:
Fix hiera hash lookups for compute

Adjusts lookups for all service hashes.
Several items set in globals and potential
hiera override tasks from plugins
are now correctly evaluated.

Change-Id: I84dbe392e6f420169033ffc651038483126c004d
Implements: blueprint detach-components-from-controllers
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Mosesohn <mmosesohn@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-09 22:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Raise minimum pbr requirement: support env markers

In neutron, commit 2bbfe6f8253659ebf6951b6426ffc446baacd420 added lines
with "environment markers"[1][2] to requirements.txt:

pywin32;sys_platform=='win32'
wmi;sys_platform=='win32'

pbr started supporting this syntax at version 1.0.0, but the neutron
and global requirements files list a minimum version of 0.11:

pbr<2.0,>=0.11

This can cause fresh installations of a project using this syntax - e.g.
neutron - to fail with e.g.:

RequirementParseError: Expected version spec in
pywin32;sys_platform=='win32' at ;sys_platform=='win32'

...if setup happens to grab that minimum version.  This change set bumps
the minimum pbr version to 1.0.0 to prevent this error.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#environment-markers
[2] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0426/#environment-markers

Change-Id: I5f57f72974721bce4b21eeb5db4b1a0abf600b33
Closes-Bug: #1471891
'}]
commit_message:
Raise minimum pbr requirement: support env markers

In neutron, commit 2bbfe6f8253659ebf6951b6426ffc446baacd420 added lines
with "environment markers"[1][2] to requirements.txt:

pywin32;sys_platform=='win32'
wmi;sys_platform=='win32'

pbr started supporting this syntax at version 1.0.0, but the neutron
and global requirements files list a minimum version of 0.11:

pbr<2.0,>=0.11

This can cause fresh installations of a project using this syntax - e.g.
neutron - to fail with e.g.:

RequirementParseError: Expected version spec in
pywin32;sys_platform=='win32' at ;sys_platform=='win32'

...if setup happens to grab that minimum version.  This change set bumps
the minimum pbr version to 1.0.0 to prevent this error.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#environment-markers
[2] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0426/#environment-markers

Change-Id: I5f57f72974721bce4b21eeb5db4b1a0abf600b33
Closes-Bug: #1471891

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-07-15 16:20:03.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Add the "OpenStack UX" Project:

The full project proposal can be found at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/UX/ProgramProposal

The mission of the UX Program is to support and
facilitate cross-project efforts to improve the overall
user experience of OpenStack.

We provide user research to help teams identify any issues
preventing adoption of their services as well as help the
projects validate design and development efforts to address
those issues. In addition, we help the project teams create
solutions to address customer needs and pain points.

Finally, we will provide the OpenStack community with
visibility into any user experience issues related to
inconsistency across projects.

The UX team is not prescriptive; our goal is to collaborate
with OpenStack’s projects to create better experiences.

Contribution
Member contribution to the UX Project would be measured on
three metrics:

* No. of mock submissions to Invision
* No. of reviews/comments in Invision
* No. of UX studies conducted on behalf of the community

Invision is being provided to OpenStack at no charge as long as
the projects are shared within the open source community.Invision’s
concern was that folks might use our platform for internal
proprietary projects, which is not allowed.

We have 12 administers and 104 managers in Invision that
can add users and create projects from companies including
IBM, Mirantis,  HP, and Redhat.  We were very careful to
make sure that no single person or company had complete
control of the platform.

We are constantly looking for open source alternatives including
phabricator (phabricator.org), which is being discussed for
adoption by the community as a code review tool. Phabricator
also includes a design review that enables users to leave comments
on an image uploaded to the system. An added benefit is that
both code and UX review would be integrated into the same tool.

It is also important to note that projects can be downloaded from
Invision as PDF files that include both images and any comments
from users.  If the community moves away from Invision, the plan
would be to make the PDFs available on the OpenStack UX wiki.

Project Communication
UX meetings were scheduled to occur every other week on IRC
but eventually slowed-down because most of the design efforts
were specifically focused on improving Horizon. That will
eventually change as the UX team engages additional projects.
In addition, IRC is a bit difficult to use within a discipline that is
largely aesthetic.

An additional way to get quick feedback or have a discussion with
the UX group is to join the IRC channel on freenode
(#openstack-ux).

There is a design review that occurs every other week were
community members are invited to share their design work
with the community. These meetings occur via virtual room
rather than IRC because the reviews require the participants to
“see” the designs in order to provide feedback.

A user panel was formed about two months ago in order to
provide feedback to the community from actual users. In
some ways, the user panel is intended to provide an alternative
“voice” to the development community.

The panel is struggling somewhat because we haven’t agreed
on a format for the meetings. For example, one suggestion was
to have a panel members talk about their specific challenges
during a session.

Panel members include users from NSA, Cisco, Pacific Northwest
National Labs, Orange and Yahoo.

Interim PTL
Until we have elections, Pieter Kruithof will be the PTL for delux.

Piet is currently a Sr UX Architect with HP Helion Cloud and
specifically focuses on improving the user experience of OpenStack.
This includes tactical activities such as proposing new designs in
addition to more strategic efforts such as providing platforms that
help enable collaboration within the community.

Piet was also a former Director with the Board of Certification in
Professional Ergonomics (BCPE). The board was established in
1990 as an independent nonprofit organization and is the certifying
body for individuals whose education and experience indicate broad
expertise in the practice of human factors, ergonomics and
user experience research.

Team members include engineers from IBM, Cisco, RackSpace,
HP and Mirantis.

Links
UX wiki
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/UX#Horizon_Proposals

User Research wiki
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HorizonUsability_Testing

OpenStack UX patterns
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/UX/PatternsLibrary

OpenStack Invision Community
https://openstack.invisionapp.com

Change-Id: I4672d15a8e91190f05ba59086cc3b15f114d5f04
'}]
commit_message:
Add the "OpenStack UX" Project:

The full project proposal can be found at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/UX/ProgramProposal

The mission of the UX Program is to support and
facilitate cross-project efforts to improve the overall
user experience of OpenStack.

We provide user research to help teams identify any issues
preventing adoption of their services as well as help the
projects validate design and development efforts to address
those issues. In addition, we help the project teams create
solutions to address customer needs and pain points.

Finally, we will provide the OpenStack community with
visibility into any user experience issues related to
inconsistency across projects.

The UX team is not prescriptive; our goal is to collaborate
with OpenStack’s projects to create better experiences.

Contribution
Member contribution to the UX Project would be measured on
three metrics:

* No. of mock submissions to Invision
* No. of reviews/comments in Invision
* No. of UX studies conducted on behalf of the community

Invision is being provided to OpenStack at no charge as long as
the projects are shared within the open source community.Invision’s
concern was that folks might use our platform for internal
proprietary projects, which is not allowed.

We have 12 administers and 104 managers in Invision that
can add users and create projects from companies including
IBM, Mirantis,  HP, and Redhat.  We were very careful to
make sure that no single person or company had complete
control of the platform.

We are constantly looking for open source alternatives including
phabricator (phabricator.org), which is being discussed for
adoption by the community as a code review tool. Phabricator
also includes a design review that enables users to leave comments
on an image uploaded to the system. An added benefit is that
both code and UX review would be integrated into the same tool.

It is also important to note that projects can be downloaded from
Invision as PDF files that include both images and any comments
from users.  If the community moves away from Invision, the plan
would be to make the PDFs available on the OpenStack UX wiki.

Project Communication
UX meetings were scheduled to occur every other week on IRC
but eventually slowed-down because most of the design efforts
were specifically focused on improving Horizon. That will
eventually change as the UX team engages additional projects.
In addition, IRC is a bit difficult to use within a discipline that is
largely aesthetic.

An additional way to get quick feedback or have a discussion with
the UX group is to join the IRC channel on freenode
(#openstack-ux).

There is a design review that occurs every other week were
community members are invited to share their design work
with the community. These meetings occur via virtual room
rather than IRC because the reviews require the participants to
“see” the designs in order to provide feedback.

A user panel was formed about two months ago in order to
provide feedback to the community from actual users. In
some ways, the user panel is intended to provide an alternative
“voice” to the development community.

The panel is struggling somewhat because we haven’t agreed
on a format for the meetings. For example, one suggestion was
to have a panel members talk about their specific challenges
during a session.

Panel members include users from NSA, Cisco, Pacific Northwest
National Labs, Orange and Yahoo.

Interim PTL
Until we have elections, Pieter Kruithof will be the PTL for delux.

Piet is currently a Sr UX Architect with HP Helion Cloud and
specifically focuses on improving the user experience of OpenStack.
This includes tactical activities such as proposing new designs in
addition to more strategic efforts such as providing platforms that
help enable collaboration within the community.

Piet was also a former Director with the Board of Certification in
Professional Ergonomics (BCPE). The board was established in
1990 as an independent nonprofit organization and is the certifying
body for individuals whose education and experience indicate broad
expertise in the practice of human factors, ergonomics and
user experience research.

Team members include engineers from IBM, Cisco, RackSpace,
HP and Mirantis.

Links
UX wiki
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/UX#Horizon_Proposals

User Research wiki
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HorizonUsability_Testing

OpenStack UX patterns
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/UX/PatternsLibrary

OpenStack Invision Community
https://openstack.invisionapp.com

Change-Id: I4672d15a8e91190f05ba59086cc3b15f114d5f04

commit_message:
Add a new CIDR type of field

Before using it, the RequestSpec object needs to have a new field providing
only the CIDR (not an IPNetwork) (eg. /24) so we need to coerce it.

Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object

Change-Id: I4857fc62bfeb7f58d8656f1a72ae12be3d261990

Add JSONString type of field

We can express sometimes a string which needs to be JSON-decoded. In that case,
we can provide a new type of field for coercing that.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-09 22:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Raise minimum pbr requirement: support env markers

Commit 2bbfe6f8253659ebf6951b6426ffc446baacd420 added lines with
"environment markers"[1][2] to requirements.txt:

pywin32;sys_platform=='win32'
wmi;sys_platform=='win32'

pbr started supporting this syntax at version 1.0.0, but the neutron
(and global) requirements file lists a minimum version of 0.11:

pbr<2.0,>=0.11

This can cause fresh installations of neutron to fail with:

RequirementParseError: Expected version spec in
pywin32;sys_platform=='win32' at ;sys_platform=='win32'

...if setup happens to grab that minimum version.  This change set bumps
the minimum pbr version to 1.0.0 to prevent this error.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#environment-markers
[2] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0426/#environment-markers

Change-Id: If67e4392f90d691e3f6c3db8165162b0ddeb6cc5
Closes-Bug: #1471891
'}]
commit_message:
Raise minimum pbr requirement: support env markers

Commit 2bbfe6f8253659ebf6951b6426ffc446baacd420 added lines with
"environment markers"[1][2] to requirements.txt:

pywin32;sys_platform=='win32'
wmi;sys_platform=='win32'

pbr started supporting this syntax at version 1.0.0, but the neutron
(and global) requirements file lists a minimum version of 0.11:

pbr<2.0,>=0.11

This can cause fresh installations of neutron to fail with:

RequirementParseError: Expected version spec in
pywin32;sys_platform=='win32' at ;sys_platform=='win32'

...if setup happens to grab that minimum version.  This change set bumps
the minimum pbr version to 1.0.0 to prevent this error.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#environment-markers
[2] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0426/#environment-markers

Change-Id: If67e4392f90d691e3f6c3db8165162b0ddeb6cc5
Closes-Bug: #1471891

commit_message:
Make trustee/trustor/project searchable by ID

In the previous implementation, we were always including the domain
argument, which caused a lookup by name for trustee/trustor and
project. By excluding it when not necessary, we do a search by
ID in find_resources.

Change-Id: Id756aeab522b5dccb2dc6b31d137a28514b0fdf6
Closes-Bug: 1473298

commit_message:
Add cache_backend and cache_options params

  * It will allow to configure horizon cache
    backend and its options in local_settings.py
  * Add tests for cache_backend and cache_options
  * Change default value of cache_server_ip to undef.
    At the moment master of horizon has default value of backend
    to: django.core.cache.backends.locmem.LocMemCache [0]
    while our template generates config with default:
    django.core.cache.backends.memcached.MemcachedCache

[0] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/deployment.html

Change-Id: I7484727fd2af26d47bc0f59e59b7f6f75daf1092
Related-Bug: #1441522

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-21 11:05:50.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/unit/dynamic_ui/test_versions.py', 'muranodashboard/dynamic_ui/version.py'], 'message': "Stringify LATEST_FORMAT_VERSION in dynamic_ui

The 'latest version' was initially specified as integer and used direct
comparison. The introduction of semver notation in I96cbb added second
segment to the version, i.e. it became X.Y. As no quotes were added this
became a floting point number. Semver function was stringifying it
before corcing, so it worked fine, however defining a version as a
floating point is definetely wrong.

This patch stringified the vesion where it is defined and adds a
function which returns a semantic_version.Version object based on it.

Change-Id: Iaed1ecdb25c49af8cf1fca2a555e6d534a380d5a
"}]
commit_message:
Stringify LATEST_FORMAT_VERSION in dynamic_ui

The 'latest version' was initially specified as integer and used direct
comparison. The introduction of semver notation in I96cbb added second
segment to the version, i.e. it became X.Y. As no quotes were added this
became a floting point number. Semver function was stringifying it
before corcing, so it worked fine, however defining a version as a
floating point is definetely wrong.

This patch stringified the vesion where it is defined and adds a
function which returns a semantic_version.Version object based on it.

Change-Id: Iaed1ecdb25c49af8cf1fca2a555e6d534a380d5a

commit_message:
Add check-requirements job to 2 projects

Add the check-requirements job to networking-bgpvpn and
networking-bagpipe-l2.

This defines more jobs than strictly needed. Quoting Andreas:
'gate-{name}-requirements' is part of python-jobs, so this adds
the requirements job for the project.

Change-Id: I4ad2208bd7bec770487e0af9c2a227699b1ee91b

subject: Correct node erase sequence
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-18 17:53:06.000000000', 'files': ['mcagents/erase_node.rb'], 'message': 'Correct node erase sequence

This sequence is more accurate as it sends SIGTERM to all processes.

- Send SIGTERM to all processes
- Trap SIGTERM
- Sync and set RO flag on all partitions
- Erase bootable partitions with dd
- Send "b" to sysrq-trigger

Closes-Bug: 1268641
Closes-Bug: 1279720

Change-Id: I4eaa6ed9b2872f55efaff0a874ac280bdba02226
(cherry picked from commit 694b5a55695e01e1c42185bfac9cc7a641a9bd48)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct node erase sequence

This sequence is more accurate as it sends SIGTERM to all processes.

- Send SIGTERM to all processes
- Trap SIGTERM
- Sync and set RO flag on all partitions
- Erase bootable partitions with dd
- Send "b" to sysrq-trigger

Closes-Bug: 1268641
Closes-Bug: 1279720

Change-Id: I4eaa6ed9b2872f55efaff0a874ac280bdba02226
(cherry picked from commit 694b5a55695e01e1c42185bfac9cc7a641a9bd48)

subject: Cleanup yum downloading
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 12092, 'name': 'Abel Lopez', 'email': 'abelopez@cisco.com', 'username': 'alopgeek'}, {'_account_id': 16272, 'name': 'Clint Adams', 'email': 'clint@gcfm.net', 'username': 'clint'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-19 23:08:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/pre-install.d/15-remove-grub', 'elements/yum/bin/install-packages'], 'message': 'Cleanup yum downloading

Using "yum --downloadonly" breaks the abstraction of
"install-packages" because it downloads to the yum cache.  It also
acts funny if the package is already there.

Add an argument to "-d" which is the directory to download to.  dnf
has "download" built in, and for the old case use yumdownloader which
acts about the same.  Ensure it is installed, since it comes in
yum-utils.

Also a slight cleanup of the getopt parsing so it's easier to have the
required argument for -d

Thus we can remove most of the stuff in 15-remove-grub.  The check for
centos6 and it's lack of grub2 is clarified.  All the stuff about
having to remove the package, purging the cache etc so yum gets the
right thing is no longer relevant.  The long section of commented out
code at the end is also removed for clarity.

I tested this with an F21, F22 & centos (6) build

Change-Id: Id1e430e7d050a0b99ac449e2ea435e06cda1c4e6
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup yum downloading

Using "yum --downloadonly" breaks the abstraction of
"install-packages" because it downloads to the yum cache.  It also
acts funny if the package is already there.

Add an argument to "-d" which is the directory to download to.  dnf
has "download" built in, and for the old case use yumdownloader which
acts about the same.  Ensure it is installed, since it comes in
yum-utils.

Also a slight cleanup of the getopt parsing so it's easier to have the
required argument for -d

Thus we can remove most of the stuff in 15-remove-grub.  The check for
centos6 and it's lack of grub2 is clarified.  All the stuff about
having to remove the package, purging the cache etc so yum gets the
right thing is no longer relevant.  The long section of commented out
code at the end is also removed for clarity.

I tested this with an F21, F22 & centos (6) build

Change-Id: Id1e430e7d050a0b99ac449e2ea435e06cda1c4e6

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-04 04:08:18.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/task/task.py'], 'message': 'Add parser for roles in dump config.

Add ability to specify all roles in the DUMP variable of nailgun settings.
That makes it possible to specify commands to execute only on the nodes
with selected roles.
Before only controllers and slaves were distinguished.
Also, role name can be specified with filters:
".random" to filter one random node withing the role
".first" to filter first node in sorted by fqdn list of node with the role
".last"  to filter last
E.g. "controller.random", or "ceph-osd.first"
Also, "master" and "local" sections of the tmeplate can be not present in the template.
Before they were mandatory.

Change-Id: I4e23b21cf276c476cf13a93a8a6c52230d4faa1b
Related-Bug: 1420054
'}]
commit_message:
Add parser for roles in dump config.

Add ability to specify all roles in the DUMP variable of nailgun settings.
That makes it possible to specify commands to execute only on the nodes
with selected roles.
Before only controllers and slaves were distinguished.
Also, role name can be specified with filters:
".random" to filter one random node withing the role
".first" to filter first node in sorted by fqdn list of node with the role
".last"  to filter last
E.g. "controller.random", or "ceph-osd.first"
Also, "master" and "local" sections of the tmeplate can be not present in the template.
Before they were mandatory.

Change-Id: I4e23b21cf276c476cf13a93a8a6c52230d4faa1b
Related-Bug: 1420054

commit_message:
Network check status flag added to cluster

This is so that we are able to warn the user that he didn't perform network
verification before doing deployment.
* added 'network_check_status' enumerated column
* added '_persist' key to task.cache dictionary -- this data will be persisted
  across multiple make_astute_message calls for a task
* refactored PUT methods in network_configuration handlers since they were very
  similar
* unified response statuses for PUT methods
* removed dead code in tests/base.py

Change-Id: I5b402dc1472104548286d443ccd9d046d3f6dfb4
Related-Bug: #1418985
Implements-blueprint: check-network-before-deployment

commit_message:
Use netaddr.EUI for representing mac address

Internal represendtation of mac addresses was changed from
string to netaddr.EUI. That allows to perform most of operations
with them in a safer and more correct way.

Change-Id: Ia6e0ceeee0723e2f725b6c2a9603ace62b7eb8b7
Closes-bug: #1395674

commit_message:
Fix hiera hash lookups for sahara and murano

Adjusts lookups for all service hashes.
Several items set in globals and potential
hiera override tasks from plugins
are now correctly evaluated.

Change-Id: I803e00a853e26fc3afd0c271851c28dc7731c972
Implements: blueprint detach-components-from-controllers
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Mosesohn <mmosesohn@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Changed node naming method to allow custom names

The mechanism of automatic node naming (using nodes' ids) changed.
Custom node names provided with UI are being used instead of automatic names.
TODO: if no name was provided, deploy action files.

Blueprint node-naming
Change-Id: I7b3a981adbd61e2a07d70623f2ea0392f3ce06d3

commit_message:
UEFI secure boot support for pxe_ilo driver

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/uefi-secure-boot-pxe-ilo

This spec proposes grub2 as a alternative bootloader for Ironic pxe
driver to add support for UEFI secure boot to pxe_ilo driver.

Change-Id: I5745fe5c30b0ba1eb67065218dec9c334884007a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-03 12:17:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_basiclib.py'], 'message': 'Fix HBSD horcm driver with oslo.concurrency 2.1.0

The oslo.concurrency 2.1.0 has replaced locks and replaced with fasteners which
means that locking stuff has moved to a generic 3rd party lib. This lib uses
the variable "path" instead of "fname".

Closes-bug: #1470112
Change-Id: I8b844c827c940a01da9cd97d8f69b3a7e42f706c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HBSD horcm driver with oslo.concurrency 2.1.0

The oslo.concurrency 2.1.0 has replaced locks and replaced with fasteners which
means that locking stuff has moved to a generic 3rd party lib. This lib uses
the variable "path" instead of "fname".

Closes-bug: #1470112
Change-Id: I8b844c827c940a01da9cd97d8f69b3a7e42f706c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 00:50:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Remove unused AlreadyAttachedClient

This is a revert of revert of the original "Remove unused
AlreadyAttachedClient" (30b198edec988d7c969c1edd4a2754bd9c9c79f4).

The removed exception was referenced in Horizon Icehouse code
and Icehouse is now EOL, so we can remove it safely now.

This reverts commit d6cfd34e13426b88b40cb6ef7fdcd60d9b7dcb6b.
Related-Bug: #1441969

Change-Id: Ic3ef81af3dab0e0aa3d0012c6e642b060488dd62

commit_message:
Remove unused AlreadyAttachedClient

This is a revert of revert of the original "Remove unused
AlreadyAttachedClient" (30b198edec988d7c969c1edd4a2754bd9c9c79f4).

The removed exception was referenced in Horizon Icehouse code
and Icehouse is now EOL, so we can remove it safely now.

This reverts commit d6cfd34e13426b88b40cb6ef7fdcd60d9b7dcb6b.
Related-Bug: #1441969

Change-Id: Ic3ef81af3dab0e0aa3d0012c6e642b060488dd62

commit_message:
Fix hiera hash lookups for cinder

Adjusts lookups for all service hashes.
Several items set in globals and potential
hiera override tasks from plugins
are now correctly evaluated.

Change-Id: I2e631eab7c6c365f2eea7a776460e67aef03d167
Implements: blueprint detach-components-from-controllers
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Mosesohn <mmosesohn@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Configuring Housekeeping agent and functions

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-16 02:17:28.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql', 'stackrc'], 'message': 'Expose MySQL max_connections setting

This patch exposes max_connections mysqld setting through
DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS.

PostgreSQL backend does set max_connections to 200, and exposes it
with MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS, while default for MySQL is 151. So we can not
just set both to the same value without changing one of them.
The same name is not used to avoid initial conflict with PostgreSQL and
to maintain naming scheme that already exists in stackrc.

PostgreSQL backend would be updated to respect the value of
DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS in a followup.

Change-Id: I0682e222a3c5b4c8297372252f32ba291ae59fca
'}]
commit_message:
Expose MySQL max_connections setting

This patch exposes max_connections mysqld setting through
DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS.

PostgreSQL backend does set max_connections to 200, and exposes it
with MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS, while default for MySQL is 151. So we can not
just set both to the same value without changing one of them.
The same name is not used to avoid initial conflict with PostgreSQL and
to maintain naming scheme that already exists in stackrc.

PostgreSQL backend would be updated to respect the value of
DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS in a followup.

Change-Id: I0682e222a3c5b4c8297372252f32ba291ae59fca

subject: Support DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS for PostgreSQL backend
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 02:17:28.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/postgresql', 'stackrc'], 'message': 'Support DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS for PostgreSQL backend

Use value of DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS if it is non-zero instead of
MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS for PostgreSQL. This way there should be no
regressions for anybody using the setting.

In the future the MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS can be removed.

200 remains as default for PostgreSQL. This can be moved to stackrc in
case we agreed to use the same default setting for all database
backends (currently PostgreSQL and MySQL).

Change-Id: I61ed0a66cea836d52e37d5eeae97fa413fcb7783
'}]
commit_message:
Support DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS for PostgreSQL backend

Use value of DATABASE_MAX_CONNECTIONS if it is non-zero instead of
MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS for PostgreSQL. This way there should be no
regressions for anybody using the setting.

In the future the MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS can be removed.

200 remains as default for PostgreSQL. This can be moved to stackrc in
case we agreed to use the same default setting for all database
backends (currently PostgreSQL and MySQL).

Change-Id: I61ed0a66cea836d52e37d5eeae97fa413fcb7783

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-11 23:03:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Don't call reschedule router with single L3 agent

When we configure multiple external provider
networks with single L3 agent and with l3_agent.ini
configured with 'external_network_bridge=br-ex',
do not reschedule the router.

Today with single L3 agent supporting multiple
external networks, the router_update command with
second external network will call the reschedule
router even when not required.

This patch will fix the problem and not call
reschedule router when there is a single agent.

Change-Id: I24294ebc981750cf90c1ded94f21718055346d15
Closes-Bug: #1405007
"}]
commit_message:
Don't call reschedule router with single L3 agent

When we configure multiple external provider
networks with single L3 agent and with l3_agent.ini
configured with 'external_network_bridge=br-ex',
do not reschedule the router.

Today with single L3 agent supporting multiple
external networks, the router_update command with
second external network will call the reschedule
router even when not required.

This patch will fix the problem and not call
reschedule router when there is a single agent.

Change-Id: I24294ebc981750cf90c1ded94f21718055346d15
Closes-Bug: #1405007

commit_message:
Add ruby-deep-merge to requirements

In order to support the 'deeper' merge behavior in hiera, we need the
deep_merge gem available to puppet. This is required to allow for
overriding our heira.

Change-Id: I8e72af25db29d558b7fcd30be7ee7de3e581aecc
Related-Bug: 1462528
Related-Bug: 1464766

commit_message:
Fix errors in fuel_plugin_example_v3

* Set volumes to empty list by default (we use this value in list's
  extend method).
* Use 'role' attribute for post deployment task, since 'groups' is used
  only for main deployment.
* Fix 'cmd' line for post deployment task.

Change-Id: I36212b106f27411edc0ce36cd1827ce14ea5eb72
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-08 17:12:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary check for tenant information

Keystone v3 has changed the name of tenants to projects which means that
OS_TENANT_NAME is meaningless in a cloud where v3 is the default
authentication version. As such, if a user does not have OS_TENANT_NAME
enabled, cinderclient will not work even though it has checks for v3
immediately below this check (and the same check replicated further
below that). Removing this allows cinderclient to work with Keystone v3
without setting OS_TENANT_NAME unnecessarily.

Further, the check for project information was incorrectly referring to
project_domain_name and project_domain_id instead of
os_project_domain_name and os_project_domain_id.

Closes-bug: 1472636
Change-Id: Ifabb4a2aec070c00349e794364a71394feea99f1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary check for tenant information

Keystone v3 has changed the name of tenants to projects which means that
OS_TENANT_NAME is meaningless in a cloud where v3 is the default
authentication version. As such, if a user does not have OS_TENANT_NAME
enabled, cinderclient will not work even though it has checks for v3
immediately below this check (and the same check replicated further
below that). Removing this allows cinderclient to work with Keystone v3
without setting OS_TENANT_NAME unnecessarily.

Further, the check for project information was incorrectly referring to
project_domain_name and project_domain_id instead of
os_project_domain_name and os_project_domain_id.

Closes-bug: 1472636
Change-Id: Ifabb4a2aec070c00349e794364a71394feea99f1

Kilo oslo-messaging deprecates qpid settings in the
DEFAULT section.

commit_message:
Add pypowervm helpers to the adapter

This change set adds common 'helpers' to the adapter.  This will enable
automated logging in case of failures with the adapter.  It will also
automatically retry in case of VIOS busy.

Change-Id: I9033e04f9ce694a0b573f221ab8415f5b5f778bf

commit_message:
Add swift::config class

Other modules provide an X::config class to be able to specify
parameters that are not yet part of the module. Swift was missing this
feature. This commit aims to add it for puppet-swift.

Change-Id: Ifb6f78f177d9cc721f8388290c983c49137a2557

commit_message:
Fix rspec 3.x syntax

- Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to'
- The old ':should' syntax in rspec 3.x is deprecated in favor of
  ':expect' syntax.
- Operator matchers:
  '1.should == 1' into 'expect(1).to eq(1)'

Change-Id: I84b993065a00f5b5c55bd6834c6d54bc57c249e0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add vio_retry helper to adapter

This change set adds the VIO retry helper to the default helper list on
the pypowervm adapter creation.  This allows for automated retry of
adapter calls when the API returns the 'VIOS is busy' error.

This can occur in highly concurrent scenarios, but is generally pretty
quick and non-intrusive.  This helper will make them more transparent
overall.

Change-Id: I6f3338ea7d2393083b58d208113cd099716a8310

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-21 14:03:51.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer_powervm/compute/virt/powervm/inspector.py'], 'message': 'Add helpers to the pypowervm adapter

Helpers are a utility within the pypowervm adapter that help with edge
scenarios that can occur when interacting with the API.  This change set
adds two of the more common helpers to the ceilometer-powervm adapter
creation.

The first is the log helper.  In the event of error scenarios, this
helper will log the error.  The second is the helper for the vio busy.
In the case of a Virtual I/O Server being busy, this will retry the
requests after a short period of time.

Change-Id: I65634f394416714c452fbd9fdc48db87b9c8ed61
'}]
commit_message:
Add helpers to the pypowervm adapter

Helpers are a utility within the pypowervm adapter that help with edge
scenarios that can occur when interacting with the API.  This change set
adds two of the more common helpers to the ceilometer-powervm adapter
creation.

The first is the log helper.  In the event of error scenarios, this
helper will log the error.  The second is the helper for the vio busy.
In the case of a Virtual I/O Server being busy, this will retry the
requests after a short period of time.

Change-Id: I65634f394416714c452fbd9fdc48db87b9c8ed61

subject: Improving SQL Injection detection
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 979, 'name': 'Dave Walker', 'email': 'email@daviey.com', 'username': 'davewalker'}, {'_account_id': 7473, 'name': 'Grant Murphy', 'email': 'grantcmurphy@gmail.com', 'username': 'gm'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}, {'_account_id': 15173, 'name': 'Rob Fletcher', 'email': 'rfletch.vol@gmail.com', 'username': 'fletcher'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-17 17:19:32.000000000', 'files': ['examples/sql_statements.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_sql.py', 'tests/test_functional.py', 'examples/sql_statements_with_sqlalchemy.py', 'bandit/core/utils.py', 'examples/sql_statements_without_sql_alchemy.py'], 'message': 'Improving SQL Injection detection

This patch replaces the noisy SQL injection test with a new
more specific test. This will catch a string that looks like
SQL that has some form of binary opperation being performed.

E.g. something like:

"select %s from derp;" % var
"select thing from " + tab
"select " + val + " from " + tab + ...

Will all trigger a low confidence warning, the old test would
warn on any string that looked like SQL, even if no operation was
performed on it. The new test also checks to see if the
discovered string is in use with a call to the standard DBAPI
calls "execute" or "executemany" to increase the result
confidence. E.g.

cursor.execute("select %s from derp" % var)

Will now give a medium confidence warning.

The severity adjustment based on the presence of SQLAlchemy has
been removed as importing the module does not alter the detected
issue at all.

Change-Id: I7bbb8bc5700146832227bc24d6c397b065ab569f
Closes-Bug: 1422916
'}]
commit_message:
Improving SQL Injection detection

This patch replaces the noisy SQL injection test with a new
more specific test. This will catch a string that looks like
SQL that has some form of binary opperation being performed.

E.g. something like:

"select %s from derp;" % var
"select thing from " + tab
"select " + val + " from " + tab + ...

Will all trigger a low confidence warning, the old test would
warn on any string that looked like SQL, even if no operation was
performed on it. The new test also checks to see if the
discovered string is in use with a call to the standard DBAPI
calls "execute" or "executemany" to increase the result
confidence. E.g.

cursor.execute("select %s from derp" % var)

Will now give a medium confidence warning.

The severity adjustment based on the presence of SQLAlchemy has
been removed as importing the module does not alter the detected
issue at all.

Change-Id: I7bbb8bc5700146832227bc24d6c397b065ab569f
Closes-Bug: 1422916

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-17 10:44:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/disk/test_api.py'], 'message': "Fix libguestfs failure in test_can_resize_need_fs_type_specified

The above test was passing a tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile object where
a path was expected. This currently works only coincidentally, because
the vfs falls back to localfs when libguestfs isn't available, and the
value is never actually used. However, it fails when libguestfs is
available in the unit test environment, because libguestfs checks the
types of its arguments.

Change-Id: I1f303079190b6a170da89ad7306926ac5000adde
"}]
commit_message:
Fix libguestfs failure in test_can_resize_need_fs_type_specified

The above test was passing a tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile object where
a path was expected. This currently works only coincidentally, because
the vfs falls back to localfs when libguestfs isn't available, and the
value is never actually used. However, it fails when libguestfs is
available in the unit test environment, because libguestfs checks the
types of its arguments.

Change-Id: I1f303079190b6a170da89ad7306926ac5000adde

commit_message:
Adds testcase for volume backup-export and import

This submission adds 'test_volume_backup_export_import' testcase
to verify cinder backup-export and import functionality.

Also added required support functions under
"backups_client.py" file.

Change-Id: I7cd268598487c61352f7f943940f3c77596be4b0

commit_message:
Adapt public HAproxy/VIP/VR to advanced networking

Use network role *public/vip* to configure HAproxy, virtual IP and virtual router.
As HAproxy and virtual IPs are connected, changes to VIPs influences HAproxy.
Some cleanups as well.

blueprint: templates-for-networking

Change-Id: I1bec9d1be779e1e80522e401c563c98b04b03ee6

subject: metricd: allow to be killed by SIGTERM
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 16:00:47.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/cli.py'], 'message': 'metricd: allow to be killed by SIGTERM

This adds a signal handler for SIGTERM that makes the process call sys.exit().
The cleanup for multiprocessing is done using atexit(), so this cleanup
everything as expected anyway.

Change-Id: I758872c63749d8cae8b9bab6561df480a82d8446
Closes-Bug: #1474996
'}]
commit_message:
metricd: allow to be killed by SIGTERM

This adds a signal handler for SIGTERM that makes the process call sys.exit().
The cleanup for multiprocessing is done using atexit(), so this cleanup
everything as expected anyway.

Change-Id: I758872c63749d8cae8b9bab6561df480a82d8446
Closes-Bug: #1474996

commit_message:
Fixes for node label management in UI

* support of label with multiple values through the node selection
* filter nodes on adding label filter without choosing its values
* change styles for standard node: label icon and labels popover

Change-Id: I47d70e66c24e76cb78388e324706d2c46f734065

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 12512, 'name': 'Deklan Dieterly', 'email': 'deklan.dieterly@hpe.com', 'username': 'deklan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 23:00:55.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Force oslo.utils<2.0

The python-monascaclient doesn't use oslo.utils but
python-keystoneclient does and version 2.0 oslo.utils can cause version
conflicts. By installing here we should avoid that situation.

Change-Id: Iccdfe86975a11b70e8a544a4e5cdbaf745ceca2c
"}]
commit_message:
Force oslo.utils<2.0

The python-monascaclient doesn't use oslo.utils but
python-keystoneclient does and version 2.0 oslo.utils can cause version
conflicts. By installing here we should avoid that situation.

Change-Id: Iccdfe86975a11b70e8a544a4e5cdbaf745ceca2c
