[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 20:02:40.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/legacy.py', 'yaql/standard_library/legacy.py', 'yaql/__init__.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'yaql/language/lexer.py', 'yaql/language/factory.py', 'yaql/tests/__init__.py', 'yaql/language/parser.py', 'yaql/tests/test_collections.py', 'yaql/tests/test_system.py', 'requirements.txt', 'yaql/language/specs.py', 'yaql/language/expressions.py', 'yaql/language/runner.py', 'yaql/standard_library/system.py', 'yaql/tests/test_engine.py', 'yaql/language/contexts.py', 'yaql/language/yaqltypes.py', 'setup.cfg', 'yaql/language/context.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Small improvements to yaql

Contexts:
* context module was renamed to contexts
* convention property is now part of ContextBase class.
* Standard Context implementation automatically uses convention
  from parent context
* Context interface was enhanced to add capability to check key presence,
   get data with different default or not try to access parent context
* MultiContext to virtually merge several contexts without of making them related.
  All merged contexts may have parents of their own which are also merged.
  Source contexts are not modified. This is sort of context mix-in

Parser:
* keyword arguments (name => value) now require name to be keyword token.
   So f('abc' => value) will not work. This doesnt affect dict() and similar functions
   as they use different argument format.
* tokens that start with two underscores (__) are no more valid. This is done so that it
  would be possible to have auto-injected Python arguments like "__context" without
  affecting possible kwargs of the same function
* "__context" and "__engine" parameters where not explicitly declared treated the
  same way as  "context" and "engine"

Delegates:
* Added ability to call delegate (callable) passed as a context value.
  The syntax is $var(args) (or even $(args)).
* Delegate doesn't have to be a context value but also can be result of expression:
  func(args1)(args2), (f() op g())() and so on
* Delegates are disabled by default for security reasons. "allow_delegates" parameter
  was added to both YaqlFactory classes to enable them
* (expr)(args) will be translated to #call(expr, args). So for this to work #call function
  must be present in context. Standard context doesn't provide this function by default.
  Use delegates=True parameter of create_context method (including legacy mode version)
  to register #call() and lambda() functions
* additional lambda(expression) method that returns delegate to passed expression thus
  making it 2nd order lambda. This delegate may be stored in context using let() method
  (or alternatives) or be called as usual. lambda(expression)(args) is equal to expression(args)

Function specs:
* FunctionDefinition now has "meta" dictionary to store arbitrary extended metadata for the
   function (for example version etc.)
* use @specs.meta('key', 'value') decorator to assign meta value to the function. Several
  decorators may be applied to single function
* Context.__call__() / runner.call() now accept optional function_filter parameter that is a
  predicate (functionDefinition, context -> boolean) to additionally filter function candidates
  based on context values, function metadata and so on.
* returns_context decorator and functionality was removed because it was shawn to be useless

Smart types:
* "context" argument was added to each check() method so that it would be possible to do
  checks using context values. Non of standard smart-types use it, however custom types may do.
* return_context flag was removed from Lambda/Delegate/Super types for the same reasons as in FD
* GenericType helper class was added as a base class for custom non-lazy smart-types simplifying
  their development
* added ability to pass received Lambda (Delegate etc) to another method (or base method version)
  when the later expects it in another format (for example seneder had Lambda() while the receiver
  had Lambda(with_context=True))

Standard library:
* "#operator_." method for obj.method() now expects first argument (sender expression) to be object
   (pre-evaluated) rather than Lambda. This doesn't brake anything but allows to override this function
   in child contexts for some more specific types of sender without getting resolution error because of
   several versions of the same function being differ by parameter laziness

Also bumps requirements to latest OpenStack global-requirements and sets version to 1.0.0b4

Change-Id: I193c9715c0a5d5a649f8391025a68176d1e31e47
'}]
commit_message:
Small improvements to yaql

Contexts:
* context module was renamed to contexts
* convention property is now part of ContextBase class.
* Standard Context implementation automatically uses convention
  from parent context
* Context interface was enhanced to add capability to check key presence,
   get data with different default or not try to access parent context
* MultiContext to virtually merge several contexts without of making them related.
  All merged contexts may have parents of their own which are also merged.
  Source contexts are not modified. This is sort of context mix-in

Parser:
* keyword arguments (name => value) now require name to be keyword token.
   So f('abc' => value) will not work. This doesnt affect dict() and similar functions
   as they use different argument format.
* tokens that start with two underscores (__) are no more valid. This is done so that it
  would be possible to have auto-injected Python arguments like "__context" without
  affecting possible kwargs of the same function
* "__context" and "__engine" parameters where not explicitly declared treated the
  same way as  "context" and "engine"

Delegates:
* Added ability to call delegate (callable) passed as a context value.
  The syntax is $var(args) (or even $(args)).
* Delegate doesn't have to be a context value but also can be result of expression:
  func(args1)(args2), (f() op g())() and so on
* Delegates are disabled by default for security reasons. "allow_delegates" parameter
  was added to both YaqlFactory classes to enable them
* (expr)(args) will be translated to #call(expr, args). So for this to work #call function
  must be present in context. Standard context doesn't provide this function by default.
  Use delegates=True parameter of create_context method (including legacy mode version)
  to register #call() and lambda() functions
* additional lambda(expression) method that returns delegate to passed expression thus
  making it 2nd order lambda. This delegate may be stored in context using let() method
  (or alternatives) or be called as usual. lambda(expression)(args) is equal to expression(args)

Function specs:
* FunctionDefinition now has "meta" dictionary to store arbitrary extended metadata for the
   function (for example version etc.)
* use @specs.meta('key', 'value') decorator to assign meta value to the function. Several
  decorators may be applied to single function
* Context.__call__() / runner.call() now accept optional function_filter parameter that is a
  predicate (functionDefinition, context -> boolean) to additionally filter function candidates
  based on context values, function metadata and so on.
* returns_context decorator and functionality was removed because it was shawn to be useless

Smart types:
* "context" argument was added to each check() method so that it would be possible to do
  checks using context values. Non of standard smart-types use it, however custom types may do.
* return_context flag was removed from Lambda/Delegate/Super types for the same reasons as in FD
* GenericType helper class was added as a base class for custom non-lazy smart-types simplifying
  their development
* added ability to pass received Lambda (Delegate etc) to another method (or base method version)
  when the later expects it in another format (for example seneder had Lambda() while the receiver
  had Lambda(with_context=True))

Standard library:
* "#operator_." method for obj.method() now expects first argument (sender expression) to be object
   (pre-evaluated) rather than Lambda. This doesn't brake anything but allows to override this function
   in child contexts for some more specific types of sender without getting resolution error because of
   several versions of the same function being differ by parameter laziness

Also bumps requirements to latest OpenStack global-requirements and sets version to 1.0.0b4

Change-Id: I193c9715c0a5d5a649f8391025a68176d1e31e47

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.reports

openstack/common/reports/ from oslo-incubator is now
in a new oslo library. So we should switch to that
library. Global requirements already has been updated.

Change-Id: I6fcba978309c1b7979524b3d2bb570a76511fbaa

commit_message:
Fix Sahara and Ceilo platform tests in case of deleting net04_ext net

If a user deletes the net04_ext network, Sahara and Ceilo platform tests
will fail. If the user deletes the net04 net, the same tests will fail,
too. To fix the issue network resources (a network, a subnet, a router)
will be created before tests to avoid such failures.

Closes-Bug: #1469877

Change-Id: Ic6132e6b55c9ab81c6236e7217f6bdd13b1c3bbe

commit_message:
Allow aodh directly acessing to its storage

Currently, alarm module has been splitted out from Ceilometer tree as
aodh. And aodh has its own storage for recording alarm definitions and
alarm changes. I think aodh don't need accessing alarm storage by
client or API any more. This change allow alarm-evaluator directly
accessing to db.

Change-Id: Ifc52ede90fbf78f387e73d5d0ffd10e9975c13f1

It happens quite often lately that Hyper-V fails to destroy
instances, returning a 32775 error code, meaning "Invalid state
for this operation".

This can lead to leaked instances.

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Retry destroying instances in case of exceptions

It happens quite often lately that Hyper-V fails to destroy
instances, returning a 32775 error code, meaning "Invalid state
for this operation".

This can lead to leaked instances.

This patch adds a retry loop, attempting to prevent this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1461970

Change-Id: Id8b9181f29aef97a009dbfe658fc5c4e6acd16bf

Memcache and Haproxy fixes for keystone

* Set [cache]memcache_dead_retry and [memcache]dead_retry
  to 300
* Change check in haproxy for keystone to rise 150

Closes-Bug: 1471318

According to https://pypi.python.org/pypi/fixtures, prior to
version 1.3.0 fixtures recommended overriding setUp. This is
still supported, but since it is harder to write leak-free
fixtures in this fashion, it is not recommended. We should
override _setUp now.

Change-Id: Id269b706c44cdb9c12e075ccb69dcb6055b18a3c
Closes-Bug: 1476573
'}]
commit_message:
Override _setUp instead setUp when we use fixtures.Fixture

According to https://pypi.python.org/pypi/fixtures, prior to
version 1.3.0 fixtures recommended overriding setUp. This is
still supported, but since it is harder to write leak-free
fixtures in this fashion, it is not recommended. We should
override _setUp now.

Change-Id: Id269b706c44cdb9c12e075ccb69dcb6055b18a3c
Closes-Bug: 1476573

commit_message:
Set 'libvirt' group for ceilometer user on compute node

  Our custom libvirt-bin package (taken from Debian)
  creates 'libvirt' group instead of 'libvirtd'.
  That's why we need to redefine groups for ceilometer user.

  Closes-bug: #1473416

Change-Id: I6b83ce1ee9429b6a747a593838896d2a5c4bc832

commit_message:
SANDBOX: copy /etc/hosts to the staging chroot

Allows people with weird setups (no DNS) to build the ISO. Having
the build system resolv.conf and hosts in the produced chroot might
be a wrong thing, so backup the original /etc/hosts (and resolv.conf)
so it's possible to restore them should that be necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1471155
Change-Id: I8a8b1305c9419d7bcddb1272e01c9c9eaf08716c

subject: docker: create a mount point for IBP image build directory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 7195, 'name': 'Matthew Mosesohn', 'email': 'raytrac3r@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmosesohn'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8777, 'name': 'Roman Vyalov', 'email': 'rvyalov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'r0mikiam'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-20 10:43:18.000000000', 'files': ['docker/mcollective/Dockerfile'], 'message': 'docker: create a mount point for IBP image build directory

Makes IBP images build time reasonable, especially if the master
node runs in a VM.

fuel_agent (which builds Ubuntu images) runs in the mcollective
container. In general OS setup generates quite a lot of IO.
fuel_agent builds the OS image in a loopback filesystem, which
results in an extra overhead. A container filesystem is backed
by dm-snapshot which is known to have a poor write performance,
especially for large files (like OS images). By default docker
storage is a loopback file residing in /var/lib/docker. Thus
the data written to the OS image being built goes through a number
of layers:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> hard drive

If the master node runs on a VM rather than a physcial hardware
the above chain gets even more complicated:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> virtual hard drive (qemu) -> qcow2 -> ext4 (host)

The write performance of such a setup is awful, as a result making
the basic Ubuntu installation takes more than 15 minutes.

Using the volume makes it possible to eliminate the extra layers,
so the written data goes through

ext4 -> loop -> ext4 -> dm-linear (os-var) -> hard drive

Related-Bug: #1457643
Change-Id: Ie47be6227e48049bc1dd3bb46fb1e58fd06d194f
'}]
commit_message:
docker: create a mount point for IBP image build directory

Makes IBP images build time reasonable, especially if the master
node runs in a VM.

fuel_agent (which builds Ubuntu images) runs in the mcollective
container. In general OS setup generates quite a lot of IO.
fuel_agent builds the OS image in a loopback filesystem, which
results in an extra overhead. A container filesystem is backed
by dm-snapshot which is known to have a poor write performance,
especially for large files (like OS images). By default docker
storage is a loopback file residing in /var/lib/docker. Thus
the data written to the OS image being built goes through a number
of layers:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> hard drive

If the master node runs on a VM rather than a physcial hardware
the above chain gets even more complicated:

ext4 -> loop -> dm-snapshot (/var/lib/docker-> loop ->
     -> ext4 (/var/lib/docker) -> dm-linear (os-varlibdocker) ->
     -> virtual hard drive (qemu) -> qcow2 -> ext4 (host)

The write performance of such a setup is awful, as a result making
the basic Ubuntu installation takes more than 15 minutes.

Using the volume makes it possible to eliminate the extra layers,
so the written data goes through

ext4 -> loop -> ext4 -> dm-linear (os-var) -> hard drive

Related-Bug: #1457643

commit_message:
Add 'retry' wrapper to manila/utils.py

Retrying library from OpenStack Requirement is already used in Manila
project. Add 'retry' wrapper around it which enables logging and
checking of input param 'retries' which may be useful.

Related-Bug: #1469068

Change-Id: I159b6e44fec9455634d76c093036f934cf400366

commit_message:
Rename label of remove router from firewall

The label of remove router from firewall is ambiguous, this patch rename it
to be more distinct, better to understand.

Change-Id: Iea3ab2e4ace75c14bcc3145c02f155136c49ff28
Closes-Bug: #1467208
(cherry picked from commit 95c17c3947dc0d4e68f9baae9f33f82bf997fda6)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-06 08:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/cli/output_parser.py'], 'message': "Adaptive details_multiple parser

1. Add 'property' and 'value' arguments to details_multiple method.
They allow programmer to explicitly specify names of columns
used as key/value in output dictoinary.

For example neutron show commands return tables with
headers: Field, Value.

2. If condition checks for following valid structure:
	first column is property
	second column is a value

Change-Id: Ia3b3dd8e8f0aad3545117404eea5905b00da11fc
"}]
commit_message:
Adaptive details_multiple parser

1. Add 'property' and 'value' arguments to details_multiple method.
They allow programmer to explicitly specify names of columns
used as key/value in output dictoinary.

For example neutron show commands return tables with
headers: Field, Value.

2. If condition checks for following valid structure:
	first column is property
	second column is a value

Change-Id: Ia3b3dd8e8f0aad3545117404eea5905b00da11fc

commit_message:
Add ability to override OpenStack privileged user auth url

Introduce os_privileged_user_auth_url config to give the ability
to override the auth_url used when authenticating
the OpenStack privileged user and bypass use of catalog found in token.

DocImpact: New os_privileged_user_auth_url config
Closes-bug: #1473206
Change-Id: I4ffca8df0eb38fe41264439ae5bb93e025c808ff

commit_message:
[Nailgun] Mix plugin volume metadata with core

Implement functionality for merging plugin volumes metadata
with release volumes metadata and using it in Volumes Manager.

Implements: blueprint role-as-a-plugin
Change-Id: Ie8e1236e4aa38b8220d937febaa50d146c9caa2a

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 11:42:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/cmd/rtstool.py', 'tox.ini', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': 'Fix Python 3 issues in cmd

* Replace filter() with a list-comprehension using if to get a list on
  Python 3.
* Get the mock module from the stdlib unittest module on Python 3.3 and
  newer, or fallback to the third-party mock module.
* Replace __builtin__ with six.moves.builtins.
* tox.ini: add the following tests for Python 3.4

  - cinder.tests.unit.test_api
  - cinder.tests.unit.test_cmd

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: Iea516ae598e8eebfc1087663a9b3e0a00d0633d3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in cmd

* Replace filter() with a list-comprehension using if to get a list on
  Python 3.
* Get the mock module from the stdlib unittest module on Python 3.3 and
  newer, or fallback to the third-party mock module.
* Replace __builtin__ with six.moves.builtins.
* tox.ini: add the following tests for Python 3.4

  - cinder.tests.unit.test_api
  - cinder.tests.unit.test_cmd

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: Iea516ae598e8eebfc1087663a9b3e0a00d0633d3

commit_message:
Add downloading artifacts and env images clean

- Add method to clean all images that were generated for
cluster provisioning in order to deploy next cluster
not on pre-generated images
- Add downloading of re-generated images and installing
them on master node

Change-Id: Iafeb9df355403f55d4ca84a2ebd7c0dfaf2fd572
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

commit_message:
Increase timeout in ceph destructive tests

In ha_sequential_rabbit_master_failover test in line
test_failover_base.py lines: L723, L748, L765 we are
waiting 300 seconds that is not enough, we should increase it to 600 seconds.

Change-Id: I4714f58f242fb6fdf51c3c6fe39f53ed43473251
Closes-Bug: #1463054

commit_message:
disable centos 6.5 deployment for fuel 7.0 release

since Kilo release of openstack is not compatible with centos 6.5,
we have to disable centos 6.5 deployments till we implement support
for new version of centos (7.0)

Change-Id: Iba60552f10b0de9e09c444600be7c3266fff31e3

subject: Listener options for Ironic/ceilometer/glance_registry
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 16282, 'name': 'YaZug', 'email': 'jschluet@redhat.com', 'username': 'yazug'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-18 00:08:50.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': "Listener options for Ironic/ceilometer/glance_registry

This updates some of the listener options set by loadbalancer.pp.

Iroinc needs to pass in the option to do a httpchk, otherwise
puppet-haproxy defaults it to doing a ssl-hello-chk, which won't work
against the non-ssl loadbalancer server.

Ceilometer and glance_registry both don't support a httpchk against the
root (/) of their webservers (they return a straight 401) so disable
those checks completely.

Change-Id: Ibfc81175842a748eb077b132b0818c4ea17bbcf6
"}]
commit_message:
Listener options for Ironic/ceilometer/glance_registry

This updates some of the listener options set by loadbalancer.pp.

Iroinc needs to pass in the option to do a httpchk, otherwise
puppet-haproxy defaults it to doing a ssl-hello-chk, which won't work
against the non-ssl loadbalancer server.

Ceilometer and glance_registry both don't support a httpchk against the
root (/) of their webservers (they return a straight 401) so disable
those checks completely.

Change-Id: Ibfc81175842a748eb077b132b0818c4ea17bbcf6

commit_message:
Remove the v3 folder for less confused

The v3 has been migrated to v2.1. The existance v3 folder
is confused for the user. So move all the files in v3 folder
to its parent.

Change-Id: I14f35270d0f8322482c7ed161418f4607576665d

commit_message:
Only use ports with non empy list of fixed_ips

A port is not necessarily attached to a subnet and therefor can have no fixed
IPs. We skip such ports to avoid a Traceback and FIP association failure.

Change-Id: I01fb1a53b0423018581f2240a004c7bb26576ec0
Closes-Bug: #1471277

commit_message:
Custom node labels in Fuel UI

Added an ability to assign custom key value labels
to particular node or node group.
These labels are used for node list sorting and filtering.

Also error nodes were unlocked to allow manage their labels.

Blueprint node-custom-attributes

Change-Id: I0b6fbec1af86dc602c39f84b7648bc223e149d05

subject: Use a lua script(s) instead of transactions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 10263, 'name': 'Vilobh Meshram', 'email': 'vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com', 'username': 'vilobhmm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-07-20 19:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': "Use a lua script(s) instead of transactions

Lua scripts are guaranteed to be atomic so we can avoid
transactions (and the resulting potential retries that
can be triggered); in general they are faster than
client side retries and are seemingly preferred over
transactions (transactions also don't rollback so they
aren't really offering to much anyway).

This replaces some of the calls that would benefit from
the atomic nature of scripts with scripts (vs there prior
usage of transactions).

Useful links:

- http://redis.io/commands/eval
- http://redis.io/topics/transactions#redis-scripting-and-transactions
- http://redis.io/topics/transactions#why-redis-does-not-support-roll-backs

Change-Id: Icba07d0c73a283c1b3575c388883bb9a9621322c
"}]
commit_message:
Use a lua script(s) instead of transactions

Lua scripts are guaranteed to be atomic so we can avoid
transactions (and the resulting potential retries that
can be triggered); in general they are faster than
client side retries and are seemingly preferred over
transactions (transactions also don't rollback so they
aren't really offering to much anyway).

This replaces some of the calls that would benefit from
the atomic nature of scripts with scripts (vs there prior
usage of transactions).

Useful links:

- http://redis.io/commands/eval
- http://redis.io/topics/transactions#redis-scripting-and-transactions
- http://redis.io/topics/transactions#why-redis-does-not-support-roll-backs

Change-Id: Icba07d0c73a283c1b3575c388883bb9a9621322c

commit_message:
Add proxy setup to fuelmenu

Added module for http_proxy and RSYNC_PROXY to
fuelmenu, primarily for use in fuel-createmirror.
Adds RSYNC_PROXY and http_proxy values to
astute.yaml as well.

Note: no upgrade impact exists since these values
are not parsed in Puppet anywhere.

Change-Id: I4df6d5e9d988e9156b820e5be4b38f458b9ccb73
Closes-Bug: #1457074

commit_message:
Retry docker load if it fails

Docker can sometimes fail when loading
images for no obvious reason. Retrying
is an easy way around intermittent errors.

Change-Id: I027badccdcd707731b4f63067aea6d128716befc
Closes-Bug: #1460139

commit_message:
Restrict environment name length to 255

Previously, there is no limitation for environment name length. A too long name
will cause HTTP 500 Internal Server Error. So restrict name length to 255, and
response a clear reason to user.

Change-Id: I1cebc9a838eb9424f81b464036fea250901d42c3
Closes-Bug: #1475226

subject: Checking pxe requirement for admin neworks fixed
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 11577, 'name': 'Ivan Kliuk', 'email': 'ivan.kliuk+spam@gmail.com', 'username': 'ivan'}, {'_account_id': 11969, 'name': 'Dennis Dmitriev', 'email': 'dis.xcom@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddmitriev'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 12559, 'name': 'Valyavskiy Viacheslav', 'email': 'vvalyavskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vvalyavskiy'}, {'_account_id': 14167, 'name': 'Andriy Popovych', 'email': 'apopovych@mirantis.com', 'username': 'apopovych'}, {'_account_id': 15454, 'name': 'Sylwester Brzeczkowski', 'email': 'sbrzeczkowski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sbrzeczkowski'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-20 09:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_nic_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py'], 'message': "Checking pxe requirement for admin neworks fixed

Calculation of pxe_name_interface in _get_pxe_iface_name fixed.
'fuelweb_admin' network assignes by default to the iface 'eth0'.
In old implementation of pxe iface name calculation the first in
list of node interfaces was selected as pxe.
For instance, if interfaces were added to node in order
['eth1', 'eth0'], the 'fuelweb_admin' network assigned to
'eth0', _get_pxe_iface_name calculates 'eth1' for pxe iface and
validation of ifaces data fails.

Change-Id: I7ddb97cfa47eb690a11c9f4dddc59ea4de060384
Closes-Bug: #1474330
"}]
commit_message:
Checking pxe requirement for admin neworks fixed

Calculation of pxe_name_interface in _get_pxe_iface_name fixed.
'fuelweb_admin' network assignes by default to the iface 'eth0'.
In old implementation of pxe iface name calculation the first in
list of node interfaces was selected as pxe.
For instance, if interfaces were added to node in order
['eth1', 'eth0'], the 'fuelweb_admin' network assigned to
'eth0', _get_pxe_iface_name calculates 'eth1' for pxe iface and
validation of ifaces data fails.

Change-Id: I7ddb97cfa47eb690a11c9f4dddc59ea4de060384
Closes-Bug: #1474330

commit_message:
Puppet: wire in tripleo::packages

This wires in use of a new puppet-tripleo class which
encapsulates the logic to enable/disable package
installation and upgrades.

By using the new class we can remove the global
Package provider declaration at the top of each
module.

Change-Id: I5c6e5fd8600031bd8fb6195649721607c560f9d5
Depends-on:  Ie8fbc344149bc8c9977e127de77636903607617a

commit_message:
SANDBOX_UBUNTU: fix APT pinning rules

The (APT) repo @ mirror.fuel-infra.org has Codename=mos6.1 instead of 'trusty',
and the repo @ obs has Codename='trusty'. SANDBOX_UBUNTU should work with
both variants.

blueprint fuel-bootstrap-on-ubuntu

Change-Id: Ia249bab2012c83e836b3d43eaf5b7293dd146d9a

commit_message:
Adapt Ceilometer to advanced networking

* Use *ceilometer/api* network role.
* Change notification_driver due to it is changed in Kilo
(http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/apt/content/ceilometer-cinder.html)

Change-Id: I3dde26b8c2961fbdc170817aca2be6d2ad6c9db1
Implements: blueprint templates-for-networking

commit_message:
Remind the user when sort_key is invalid

When a user retrives a list of bays or containers with a invalid
sort_key, magnum now returns internal server error. We should
remind the user that the sort_key is invalid.

Change-Id: I07f4502bd1d7f713162c0582025d586cbfdadc4c
Closes-Bug: #1474693

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-16 17:32:50.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/hp/test_hp_3par_driver.py', 'doc/source/devref/hp_3par_driver.rst', 'manila/share/drivers/hp/hp_3par_driver.py', 'manila/share/drivers/hp/hp_3par_mediator.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/hp/test_hp_3par_constants.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/hp/test_hp_3par_mediator.py'], 'message': "HP 3PAR uses scoped extra-specs to influence share creation options

Add support for share type extra-specs that can be used to influence
share creation options that are specific to 3PAR. These extra-specs
are scoped (use 'hp_3par:' prefix).

CIFS extra-specs include 'smb_abe' (access based enumeration),
'smb_cache' and 'smb_ca' (continuous availability). 'smb_ca' is
ignored until hp3parclient > 3.2.1.

The NFS extra-spec is 'nfs_options'. This value is a comma-separated
string as needed for the 3PAR createfshare -options value in the CLI.
The following values are not allowed because the driver uses
specific settings (for now): (no_)root_squash, (in)secure.
The following values are not allowed per HP 3PAR CLI support
requirements: no_subtree_check, fsid.
'rw' and 'ro' are not allowed because read-only access should be
controlled by Manila and not by extra-specs.
Additional value validation is left to the 3PAR CLI to handle.

Implements Blueprint: hp3par-extra-specs
Change-Id: Ia311cae718bf3998346b068aebb08a64924195de
"}]
commit_message:
HP 3PAR uses scoped extra-specs to influence share creation options

Add support for share type extra-specs that can be used to influence
share creation options that are specific to 3PAR. These extra-specs
are scoped (use 'hp_3par:' prefix).

CIFS extra-specs include 'smb_abe' (access based enumeration),
'smb_cache' and 'smb_ca' (continuous availability). 'smb_ca' is
ignored until hp3parclient > 3.2.1.

The NFS extra-spec is 'nfs_options'. This value is a comma-separated
string as needed for the 3PAR createfshare -options value in the CLI.
The following values are not allowed because the driver uses
specific settings (for now): (no_)root_squash, (in)secure.
The following values are not allowed per HP 3PAR CLI support
requirements: no_subtree_check, fsid.
'rw' and 'ro' are not allowed because read-only access should be
controlled by Manila and not by extra-specs.
Additional value validation is left to the 3PAR CLI to handle.

Implements Blueprint: hp3par-extra-specs
Change-Id: Ia311cae718bf3998346b068aebb08a64924195de

commit_message:
Fix environment intialization logic

This is an attempt to eliminate the possibility that the global
environment variable gets set but not recovered. It could be the reason
that plugins are not always loaded successfully.

Change-Id: I7b18972b18255cd3f457286865d9628eb9639104

commit_message:
Restrict environment template name length to 255

Previously, there is no limitation for environment template name length. A too
long name will cause HTTP 500 Internal Server Error. So restrict name length to
255, and response a clear reason to user.

Change-Id: I90ebfa5c9cd36925d14a2a3cbf5287d3908d3e75
Related-Bug: #1475226

commit_message:
Amend docs on OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE

If this value doesn't match with keystone.conf's member_role_name, then
a deployment will end up with two roles serving basically the same
purpose, which would be confusing to operators and end users.

Change-Id: Ia75f62243115778ab473662f460fda1669d15436

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-20 18:54:47.000000000', 'files': ['environments/cinder-netapp-config.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/controller/cinder-netapp.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Fix Puppet Configuring NetApp Cinder Backend

It was incorrectly assumed that Puppet variables assigned to a
defined class (as seen in cinder-netapp.yaml) would be applied to
any resources created with that type. This is not how Puppet works.

The full range of configuration parameters to cinder::backend::netapp
have been added back in. They are still pulling from Hiera like they
were intended before, but it needs to be a little more explicit for
Puppet to be happy.

Change-Id: I2e00eae829713b2dbb1e4a5f296b6d08d0c21100
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Puppet Configuring NetApp Cinder Backend

It was incorrectly assumed that Puppet variables assigned to a
defined class (as seen in cinder-netapp.yaml) would be applied to
any resources created with that type. This is not how Puppet works.

The full range of configuration parameters to cinder::backend::netapp
have been added back in. They are still pulling from Hiera like they
were intended before, but it needs to be a little more explicit for
Puppet to be happy.

Change-Id: I2e00eae829713b2dbb1e4a5f296b6d08d0c21100

commit_message:
Set is_deployable=False for old releases

We don't want to be old releases available for new deployments. We want
them only available for management. Hence, turn off them for new
deployments.

Closes-Bug: #1476172

Change-Id: I729d463f6e3863e22aa7b26d071578c815769eca
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

Rackspace public cloud (for example), has a laughably tiny limit on the
size of userdata that can be passed without config-drive.

This change adds `config_drive` (default False) to OpenStackProvider

commit_message:
OpenStackProvider: Allow userdata using config_drive

Rackspace public cloud (for example), has a laughably tiny limit on the
size of userdata that can be passed without config-drive.

This change adds `config_drive` (default False) to OpenStackProvider
options and passes it through to nova when creating servers.

Change-Id: I4c07d4119ac3b482d8446de783d67b82ea8bfed8

commit_message:
Split keystone endpoint creation into respective tasks

- Refactor ceilometer auth.pp. It's a part of
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201565/ though it's required by
  endpoint task separation
- Moved keystone endpoint creations to separate tasks with initial noop
  tests

Misc:
- Created Unified structure in creation tasks. They are separated as
  <task>/db.pp and <task>/keystone.pp
- Removed firewall.pp.dist.
- Removed database requirement in ceilometer/tasks.yaml
- Fixed notification in heat.pp
- many linting fixes

Partial blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers

Co-Authored-By: Bartłomiej Piotrowski <bpiotrowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Mosesohn <mmosesohn@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I61376f2bbeade23ae1d49a82f4e908be28144e78

commit_message:
Add base_attribute schema for all resources

- base_attributes_schema was added for base resource class.
- 'show' attribute was added to base_attributes_schema.
- fixed corresponding unittests
- definition of 'show' attribute was deleted from some resources,
  because now it's presented in base resource class.
- Also was added temporary hook for stack_resource class to stop
  resolving 'show' attribute.

Change-Id: Ie07fdc28a98be72064692ebffaf6d0c3eb128887

subject: Fixed the tests in test_models.py
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 10453, 'name': 'octopuszhang', 'email': 'zhangyf@rc.inesa.com', 'username': '1'}, {'_account_id': 13355, 'name': 'Edmond Kotowski', 'email': 'ekotowski@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekotowski'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-29 14:07:49.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/mgmt/test_models.py'], 'message': 'Fixed the tests in test_models.py

The tests were failing when run as a single module
for the test-module trove.tests.unittests.mgmt.test_models

There were two reasons of failure:
- test_models.TestMgmtInstanceDeleted.test_show_deleted_mgmt_instances fails
  because this test expects some deleted/active instances to pre-exist.
- other tests were failing because MockMgmtInstanceTest.build_db_instance
  was trying to create test-instances using a non-existent version.

Change-Id: Ie0b4bb9b60f451f97961744d19f62cd7f0240458
Closes-Bug: #1469724
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the tests in test_models.py

The tests were failing when run as a single module
for the test-module trove.tests.unittests.mgmt.test_models

There were two reasons of failure:
- test_models.TestMgmtInstanceDeleted.test_show_deleted_mgmt_instances fails
  because this test expects some deleted/active instances to pre-exist.
- other tests were failing because MockMgmtInstanceTest.build_db_instance
  was trying to create test-instances using a non-existent version.

Change-Id: Ie0b4bb9b60f451f97961744d19f62cd7f0240458
Closes-Bug: #1469724

commit_message:
Allow to enforce API behavior without keystone

This change allows to enforce the API behavior without quering keystone
to known if aodh or gnocchi are enabled.

It uses oslo.config options instead.

Change-Id: Ibf40cc098d84a21313130873951dc2984541fdcb

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-20 23:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/__init__.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/db/bgpvpn_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/dummy.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/ml2_mech_driver.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/bagpipe.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Remove BGPVPN plugin dependency on database

The service plugin inherits from a default database model.
For drivers that use a third party to persists BGP/VPN connections,
the service plugin does not need database.

That patch introduces 2 driver interfaces:
- BGPVPNDriver: for drivers that uses third party to persists data
- BGPVPNDriverDB: for drivers that needs the service plugin BGP/VPN
  to persist data

Change-Id: Ic3431dee0283c8b44674356665b039f6689d091f
Closes-bug: #1472203
'}]
commit_message:
Remove BGPVPN plugin dependency on database

The service plugin inherits from a default database model.
For drivers that use a third party to persists BGP/VPN connections,
the service plugin does not need database.

That patch introduces 2 driver interfaces:
- BGPVPNDriver: for drivers that uses third party to persists data
- BGPVPNDriverDB: for drivers that needs the service plugin BGP/VPN
  to persist data

Change-Id: Ic3431dee0283c8b44674356665b039f6689d091f
Closes-bug: #1472203

like the simulater tests.

commit_message:
Convergence: Simulator tests

Adding scenarios without modification from:
https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/tree/resumable/scenarios

Tests will be added to test these scenarios. The tests will call actual
Heat code. RPC and DB APIs will be mocked. The scenario also requires a
new type of template to be added.

Change-Id: I4f7082700d2f84853bc8495a0f93a3c7fbaa602a
Implements: convergence-simulator-tests
Co-Authored-By: Ishant Tyagi <ishant.tyagi@hp.com>

commit_message:
Propose extensions to Nailgun API for environment upgrade

This proposal covers extensions to Nailgun API included in release 7.0 and aimed
to support upgrade of MOS environment under management of Fuel installer. These
extensions are related to creation of shadow environment to facilitate upgrade
of controller nodes.

Change-Id: I0ab8876125cfc149ddf2f14faefc54f8bd434f82
Blueprint: nailgun-api-env-upgrade-extensions

Do not import using oslo namespace

Importing using oslo namespace will not work with oslo.utils
2.0.0 library.

Closes-Bug: #1476368
